Our waitress quickly "sprung into action" and exclaimed, oh, let me get you a towel for that...and then...the best part....SHE NEVER CAME BACK!!!!!   So there we are sitting at our table, with the only two paper napkins anywhere to be seen, soaked with soda, waiting.   Then, I look across the patio, to one of the other two tables in the entier place that have customers, and I see our lovely waitresss, TAKING THEIR FOOD ORDER!!!!!    She finally returns, apologising for not coming back sooner, and I just smile at her.  Then, she again suggests I order another pizza for my husband, and we can just make it the way he wants, no onions/garlic, etc.  At NO POINT during my interaction with her, after making it clear I didn't want the pizza she brought from the very beginning, did I ever imply I wanted to PAY FULL PRICE FOR A SECOND PIZZA!!!!!!    So, having said that, she returns with a second pizza, which at any other reputable establishment, would have been complimentary, given the series of events that had transpired that evening.    My bill came, and I was charged 16.00 for the disgusting burnt onion and crust pizza, AND for the actual pizza that I had wanted from the beginning, I was charged another 18.00!!!!!!!  Grazie is a poor excuse for a restaurant, and it's customer service is embarassing.  My bill came to over 85.00, for one adult, and an 8 year old.  Next time, my 8 year old and I will be going to the House Brasserie next door to Grazie, as they actually are deserving of the 85.00 tab that I would expect to receive there, because the food and service are 5 stars always.  If I had the energy tonight, I would have refused to pay  tab delivered to my table.  I was already traumatized by her inability to understand customer service, so I paid and left.  I will NEVER EVER return to this establishment, and am considering calling my bank to dispute the charges.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Disgusting burnt pizza for 16.00!!! Go elsewhere!

Nrvp6BGoWPFVdbesiYx7EA.text: I went here with a Groupon and couldn't be more pleased.   The groupon included a bottle of Sangria and a full pizza.  The white sangria was delicious and refreshing. We had a hard time choosing betweent the amazing selection, but went with the Cinque Formaggio which included ricotta, gorgonzola, mozzarella and two other cheeses.  Absolutely delicious.  The crust was crispy, the cheese was gooey and outstanding and we added proscuitto. I will defintely be coming back. Adorable little patio outside and.. they are dog friendly!

-uuhN7oozOg-DUAQw4KXKQ.text: Alright.  Ready for my two cents?  My client told me about this place not to long ago.  She knows how I am about pizza ;)) well anyways.  I came across a Groupon for it. I was ecstatic!!!!!!!!  My boyfriend and I went for date night. Right when we walked in, we got sat down right away. BUT 15 minutes later,  our waiter was no where to be found nor knew who was our waiter. I had to ask who our waiter was. One, she didn't speak English nor I can comprehend. Two, she kept smiling at me when I was talking to her,  she didn't listen to what I say.  honestly, whenever I had a question or command something,  I had to ask TWICE!!! Smh.  These couple came in 30 minutes after us, THEY GOT THEIR FOOD BEFORE US. I confronted the manager, he did not care, he said don't worry.  It'll come out.. wtf are you serious?    And, Whatttt? No hot sauce or ranch? Yeah. I was bummed out.  Overall. Horrible customer service. But I love my pizza .

C03AJD0GU55-Q8vfV3K_6A.text: This is a fantastic place not just the amazing food but Sandy will make your dinning experience amazing because she cares deeply about her food and clientele!

poZ2Q9f-JZC0FXKM3uucrQ.text: Thanks to Groupon, we were able to find this place. Located in Old Town just West of the Arts District, this Pizza joint is tucked away and kind of hard to find if you're not familiar with the area. The signage is small and hard to read from the street. Also, the parking here is atrocious....very few spots on the street and a tiny parking lot adjacent to the restaurant. There's also a few lots across the street, but they belong to other businesses and you might get ticketed there....we took a chance and parked behind Prestige Cleaners across the street....there were no other spots avail, we had no choice. To enter, you have to walk through a small section of their patio seating. The indoor dining room is pretty small and tables are tight....I don't recommend for groups larger than 6 people...outside seating is better for that. Since it was still blazing hot outside, we sat inside. After browsing the menu, we decided to order: Americana Pizza (Pepperoni, Cheese), $15 yelp.com/biz_photos/graz... yelp.com/biz_photos/graz... Complimenti Alla Mamma Pizza (Ham, Salame, Parmigiano Reggiano, Ricotta, Mozzarella), $16 Caprese, $9 Red Sangria yelp.com/biz_photos/graz... The Caprese came out first and was very good. The portion size can easily feed 2 people as an appetizer. Both of the Pizzas we had were very good. I thought the Alla Mamma Pizza was better than the Americana Pizza...but they were both excellent. The Americana was a bit soggy for our tastes (too much Sauce)...but it was full of flavor. The Sangria helped us wash it all down....it comes in a nice sized carafe....can easily satisfy 2 or 3 people. Service here was pretty good too. Overall, a nice time out. Return Factor - 77%

Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sangria served in a frosted glass tonight, ice cold and yummy!

9hINmYS5pR5-NGsKvA1-Wg.text: Popped in for dinner and had a great experience! I had the 1/2 calzone 1/2 pizza and even ordered a vegetarian pizza to go. Great flavor and really fresh food that's homemade.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Vegetarian pizza!

BM9CN8bcJavNAl8rT57MyA.text: Passing through Scottsdale while moving with my wife and we decided to stop here because is was walking distance from our hotel. Absolutely amazing place. The Chicken Parmigiana was outstanding. My wife got the Napoli pizza and said it was "the best pizza she has ever had". Service was great. Laid back atmosphere. Wine selection was quite nice. Definitely a great place!

zBeJfUN58BWDc2Rfb5zQ0Q.text: There's nothing like a good pizza and some wine... =)  My boyfriend bought a groupon for this place so we came here for our date this past weekend. I really liked the setting and outdoor patio of the place. A really good date spot or even a place to get together with friends for dinner. The downside was that their air conditioner was down! We are in Arizona so you can imagine how hot it was. It was actually cooler outside than it was inside. Thank god for those water misters! lol.   We ordered the Toscana pizza and a pitcher of the White Sangria to wash it down. This place actually reminded me of Sauce. They have the thin crust pizza. I really liked it. Ours was more of a Supreme pizza so it had all the toppings that I loved on it. The Sangria was also tasty. Not too sweet like it usually is.   I felt like the customer service was a bit slow. It was a bit busy when we were there so that's understandable. It took them a while to come over to our table just to get our drink orders. When we requested to get some balsamic vinegar with our bread the waitress forgot about it but she did apologize when she finally brought it to us.   Despite the a/c being down and the customer service being a bit slow I would come back. I really liked the food as well as the ambiance of the restaurant. =)

l87G47Imb68xKrZ2eQUtnQ.text: High expectations & left very very very disappointed with food & worst part - the LACK of service.  So appalled at the rude & untrained waiters & so called manager.  Let me explain: This place was recommended by a neighbor as a hidden hot spot.    We dine out often & were happy to check out new pizza place.   We ordered 2 pizzas (mamia & vegetarian) & salad.  And asked for pizzas to come out with salad. The waitress brought out pizzas with no salad & no utensils or plates or peppers & cheese.  We  reminded her no problem.  Then she disappeared and made us feel bad for asking questions and for basic dining service. Worst dining experience ever I decided for first time to write a review.

PB-JxBY3zdoUCRCS-bTGEA.text: Our appetizers came quickly. The flavors were good but the food was cold in the center. The service was very very poor.... Even with a slow crowd (2-3 tables). I would not recommend this place and opt for other choices in the area. Seems this place caters to wine enthusiasts ! The pizza was burned but the ingredients seemed OK.

Y7w6NLdylhWyh7OQomaenQ.text: We used to really enjoy Grazie. The service was poor. Our waitress was very distracted. Once we finally ordered, we were told the appetizer was not available. The pizza came out with a burnt crust. The chicken Parmesan was tasteless as the Bolognese sauce. One special was tasty. Had to try to get the waitresses attention for everything. We will not be coming back.

jFtaICdfE7xlI8zTpKadaw.text: Grazie is my kind of place! Coming from New York City, it's hard to find good Italian food in Arizona. The food was great, the people are real, and I will most definitely be back soon. My friend is a foodie and knows his restaurants. This was a great choice.

zovBGVjqg1xeUM0vz8hBPQ.text: Service was painfully slow and although the salad was good, the pizza arrived burned around the edges and lacking flavor. With restaurants like The Parlor and LGO, I'm not sure why anyone would give this place a 2nd try.

uKRM40H1jupqGZ0D5unjNg.text: if you like crunchy crust, you'll love-a da grazi!  the first time i went there, was on a date with my now husband, and my head was turning the whole night because i'm pretty sure at that point, they had imported some of the prettiest people in italy and forced them to work there. for real. anyway, never had a bad pizza or salad here. i love my crust crunchy and i'm never disappointed (unlike LGO's soggy-pizza-center-issue). if you really want to go all out, order the calzone for dessert: huge and filled with bananas and nutella and cooked in the oven. (me: we can't eat all this! 10 minutes later, me: i can't believe we ate all that.) hit up the patio for a killer place to eat outside in scottsdale, without feeling like you're outside in scottsdale, aka on a bad runway where the models only look like tara reid.

5hzEs58gJwhxUAgYG-5oBA.text: I love this place. Convenient location, friendly and fast service. The pizza was fantastic, and their wine selection was simple yet extensive. They also have wine specials and a larger outdoor patio that is sorta hidden. This place is adorable and I love coming here on a laid back evening.

LRudNwUYamj6bO38wbY8Ug.text: good pizza and large wine list...  I like it since it is off the beaten path in Old Town...  i agree that it is a nice group place... they also have a pretty nice outdoor area.

lUSrbzocz_sdQGu03A7uBQ.text: Just as I said in my review in February, I returned and had the Insaladda della Casa then the Complimenti alla Mamma pizza.  Just like before, everything was excellent and I would order it again.  I just wish I remembered to read my earlier review before returning so I would be sure to order something different.  All the pizzas sound good and I want to try each one.  The service was very good.  Our waitress didn't seem to mind that we kept wanting to sample wine before we bought a bottle.  Their wine selection, by the way, is very good and reasonably priced.  Finally, I must add that sitting inside can be a bit noisy when it is crowded.  Temperature permitting, the patio is a better place to sit, eat and chat.

N1GMQQE7JshE3ZAhqGzr3A.text: 2nd time I went to Grazie and both times it was excellent. The service is fast and attentive and the food great. The portions are huge so there is no problem to share the starter or the thin crust, wood-fired pizza ... So far I had the Dame Edna and the Roma pizza and both were very tasty. The wine collection is great and has some very interesting stuff which includes also less expensive wines. Haven't made it to the desert menu yet as both times there was no space left ...

W2hmGIFnVnnbb1rfSL2Urg.text: Excellent atmosphere...great place for a date as well! Pizza was delicious and needless to say the nutella calzone was yummy! what stuck out the most, again was the atmosphere..i really enjoyed it!

BNuJmOWcGwFF9lFgnCyvAQ.text: Very cozy restaurant with outside seating. On weekend nights, ton of energy. Awesome food. Pizza is thin and very generous with the quality toppings. Price is not too bad for the pizza size and taste you get.

i5j52npiSVIC6dMo_Hgifw.text: Grazie is a very good place for pizza!  And the ambiance is wonderfully cozy.  It's especially nice on evenings outside on the patio.  Their salads are large and delicious also.  But the reason for 4 stars is because a couple of times the pizza was burnt.  Not good!  But when its cooked just right, its fabulous.

1OPa3_V9F9gy0g8TpV7qvQ.text: My family and I went to Grazie's for dinner with a Groupon.  On our first attempt, we could not be seated as the restaurant was so busy.  So the following time, we called ahead of time and reserved a table for 6.  We showed up at the reservation time only to be told that they did not have us down.  However, after consulting with a person who looked like the owner, we were told that they had not understood the name and sat us at a table that was appropriate for 4 people, but not for 6!  Anyway, we sat down and waited for a while, until the waiter came to take our order.  The place was so loud that waiters and us had a difficult time communicating.  Meantime, I had discovered that my chair was wiggly beyond my comfort zone, and then my father (an elderly man) showed me that his chair was unglued at the junction of the seat and the leg.  I requested new chairs for the two of us and they were given to us in a not so friendly manner.  When the pizzas arrived, there was no room to place them on the table, because this pizzeria does not use pizza stands and as I said, we were in too small a table!  However, we managed, and ate.  The pizzas were tasty, not great, but not bad either.  One of them had a burnt crust.  During our whole experience (and especially during the chair incident) I kept on glancing toward the "owner".  He avoided my eyes and of course never approached our table!  The GROUPON that we presented at payment was applied in the most profitable way for Grazie (a $4 difference that could have made a great difference in customer satisfaction!).  Oh well, we are never going back to Grazie...

LEkG2ivUMSX2o4EkR_KfgA.text: Unfortunately, my experience with this restaurant was very disappointing.  I'm sure their food is tasty but my party and I never even had the opportunity to try it.  I had booked an evening reservation for a group of nine and after arriving (on time and all together) we were escorted to a back table.  Then, a minute later we were asked to wait outside as that table was actually reserved for a larger party who was running behind.  Although a little confused, we all obliged and waited outside of the restaurant.  30 minutes later, still no table.  The staff weren't exceptionally helpful and after asking to speak with the manager (who didn't seem to care much about the situation) we decided to leave.  It was a shame because we were really looking forward to dining there.  I understand that restaurants are often extremely busy for the dinner rush but if you're already overbooked, don't agree to take on another group reservation.  I imagine the service is better during off-peak hours but after our experience, I won't be going back to try it out.

xaQ975lktCBYmHCEZWYsfA.text: The food here was rather disappointing. My friend and I shared the misto platter (assortment of cheeses and meats). It came with two types of cheese (one edible, one chalky and flavorless) and three types of meet (the salami was alright, the other two were not). Although the appetizer platter was generous (which is good because it cost $15) there wasn't much on it worth eating. The sandwich was alright, but the pizza was greasy and ungenerous (it seemed like it was pre-made, frozen, then cooked). The only upshot is the nice outdoor seating and great wine menu, with reasonably priced glasses. If I came back here again, which I doubt I will, I would just stick to the wine. Lastly, the waitress was nice and helpful, but she also complained to us about some of the other customers at the restaurant, which was quite awkward.

gQgu3639vTl2_yvnaWSqJQ.text: I had a hard time deciding how to rate this one.  Cozy small neighborhoody ambiance makes it a great date spot and is worthy of 4 stars.  The salads are 5 stars.  Really amazing.   The pizza...  eh.  I much prefer the pizza at LGO, Cibo, or Grimalidi's.  I would come back here for salad or to chill on the patio.  Probably will not be back for the pizza.  Since it is primarily a pizza place, I had to knock it down to 3 stars, despite the stellar salad and ambiance.

6NkCYQBfCn9pl6cTwlk2fw.text: Horrible service.  We received 2 pizzas that were way over cooked: burnt.  We told the manager/owner of this and basically told us to deal with it.  Reading other reviews on Yelp and Google:  seems to be a running theme.  Have been a few times, food is OK-atmosphere is better.  However, with this run of poor service, I will never go back.

7xac-T5AAOPq4lH7kfnPoQ.text: My wife and I ate  regularly here (weekly) and we thought it was pretty spectacular. However we have noticed that the food quality has regressed markedly and consistently. I do not know if it is a new chef or new ingredients from a different supplier. Too bad....

_9-RB3qSLukqIsBH_xDGgQ.text: I think that they have the BEST pizza in town!!!! Way better than Pizzeria Bianco!!!!!

2Uok4VxIESXKWWPaXUL_0A.text: We should've reconsidered when we saw the dog walking on the bar...seriously!!!  I like dogs, but this was too much. This dog was on the bar most of the time we were there, until a customer, who seemed a regular, picked it up and put in on a bar stool.  There was also another dog comfortably seated on one of the bar stools.  Not sure why we didn't walk out then, but...  After being seated, noticed tabletops were not clean, ditto for the floor.  There was only one other table occupied, so we figured at least we'd have our food quickly.  It's a small, dark place, but has a large, although not attractive, patio.  The service was good, and we had our food in a timely manner.  The Caesar salad was not crisp, and was drenched in dressing. There was no fresh Parmesan or croutons, which at $14, was overpriced.  The Toscano pizza arrived, undercooked in the center, and not visually appealing. There were abundant, but not fresh mushrooms, and the "fennel" sausage had no flavor of fennel.  There was not much flavor except of mushrooms.  I would never return to this restaurant, and would highly discourage anyone else from eating there.

2EEs6jtn4gibVak1_nuD3Q.text: Loved it! I went on Sunday evening with my boyfriend and we got the livingsocial deal for pizza & sangria which were both fantastic.  We also ordered a salad which was delish but if you don't like a lot of salad dressing be sure to order the dressing on the side, it was quite a lot.  We were so busy enjoying our food that a little dust storm blew through and we hardly noticed (even though we were sitting outside.)  My only complaint would be that service was a little slow but it's a quaint, quiet atmosphere that is not packed with hostesses and servers jostling everywhere so, in my opinion, the quiet evening (with fantastic food) was completely worth waiting a little longer for service :) This is a great place for a date night or a girls night, check it out!

gaFN41gVsKG3OC_CNFmaMg.text: I am so bummed about our recent trip to Grazie. We have been going at least for the last 7 years. We came with a Groupon, and received the WORST service. We were mid-order, and the waitress walked off before we could finish. She seemed to be very much in a hurry, even though the restaurant was only half full, if that. She barely gave us any time to ask any questions, as she would fly by our table. We asked if she would recommend the white or red sangria, as it was included in the Groupon. She said the red was good, and then said, "Oh, you must have the Groupon." She barely gave us attention the rest of our visit there. Once we got the sangria, which we have ordered before, it seemed flat and tasteless. In the past, there has been a lot of fresh fruit cut up, and this time there was none. The pizza is always so good, and this time, it tasted like it was missed something... with all of the veggies and cheese, it ended up tasting like not much of anything. The owner was there with his dog sitting at the bar too, which seemed a little odd. We love Grazie, and we will give it another try sometime soon. I hope the next experience is better than the last. With so many pizza places around these days, I hope Grazie strives to do better in the future.

Zyup_tRymlKokx7ESmiOzg.text: Ok, so before I go out to any new spot I always check Yelp. I am honestly surprised by how good a food rating Grazie got on here! We went in on a Sunday at 8, so we were seated promptly. That was nice since we brought our 16 month old son. The atmosphere is cozy, and warm- it feels like a place where you would want to celebrate and enjoy a bottle of wine. They even had a cute patio.  Our server was polite, offered us a taste of the bottle of wine before we decided- and overall was attentive enough to our needs with out being overbearing. Service was prompt, and even though we ordered an app and dinner at the same time we were given enough time in between to not feel rushed.  That is where my experience turned. We ordered the Bruschette Miste, and overall we were disappointed with the quality. The portion was good, but the italian sausage and cheese was overly spicy, the pesto was flavor-less (as was the white bean), and the tomato was only diced tomato. We drenched them all in balsamic and waited for dinner.  For dinner we got the Dame Edna(a pizza) and Melanzane Parmigiana (eggplant) to share. We were pleased with the pizza. It had a fair amount of prosciutto, and arugula piled on top- it looked beautiful and tasted good. All of the flavors were bold and still complimented each other very well. The eggplant parmigiana was sadly a very different story. The presentation, again was very nice, but the flavors were not there. The eggplant was totally overshadowed by the breading which was heavy and thick. The red sauce had good flavor, but was somewhat sparse leaving the whole dish dry and unappealing.   For dessert we had the Calzone.. ok, this was yummy. It came out warm, and the nutella and banana are a delish combination. The regular size was plenty to share between 3-4 people.. even though there was not a bite left on the plate! This was a highlight of our meal- but it is something you could recreate somewhat easily at home.  Overall, there were bright spots in the meal- the pizza and desert were both yummy, but I think I am going to be trying somewhere different the next time we are in the mood for Italian or Pizza.

AOel1ChCPPHR8B-1wLMN5A.text: The pizza here is very yummy. It must be the delicious thin and flavorful crusts baked to perfection. I got the skewered meat that was succulent and juicy. The pizza was  crispy, sweet (due to the carmelized onions), and salty. The service was also wonderful. They took great care of us. The best part was the dessert. A huge calzone stuffed with banana and nutella, topped with vanilla. I got a spoon just so I could get as much of the deliciousness as possible.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Who knew Italians are great at making kabobs?!

cBlnlLGW8cH0_ghIfmLzlQ.text: Went here for a bachelorette party (yeah, we were the loud group of 9 gals) on a Sat night; Our server, Tommy, was great (5 starts) - he was friendly, quick, and got our orders and checks split properly.  I felt bad for him because we one of those obligatory token drunk girls (not the bride-to-be, thankfully) with us being completely loud and obnoxious .. he just smiled pleasantly and did his job - Kudos to Tommy!  The ambiance is nice and it was a nice setting for our little intimate event.  The menu was quite pizza-centric, but when is that a bad thing?  I liked how their crust was really thin and crunchy and they had quite a selection of pizzas and wines.  Note however that when one of my friends ordered 'just a merlot', the waitress (another girl helping out) brought out a $10+ glass of Merlot.. not the 'house' Merlot, but a premium Merlot.  Nice job there.  Here's where the minus stars come in: -1) Ordered a macchiato.  This was bitter and astringent, a sign that the beans were under-extracted. -1) Our Toscano pizza was not impressive with the flavor nor the ingredients... it lacked in unity and harmony of flavor. I think I could give this place another shot, however... since I rarely venture in to Scottsdale for dinner, I'm not sure I'll get another chance in the near future.  In short, I've had better and it was OK for me.

PK6el124nk48AGgCsqo1uA.text: Oh my goodness I am in love with this place!  After moving to the area and passing by numerous times, I bit the bullet and made a last minute reservation for 2.  I'm pretty sure I called at 6:45 on a Friday and they had a table for me at 8...perfect amount of time to fix my makeup and walk over.  We arrived at a very busy, yet almost casual vibe.  I gave them my name, and we were seated right in the middle of the restaurant(and right in the middle of the action).  Now let me preface by saying I am kind of a snob when it comes to seating in a restaurant.  If they put me all the way in the back, anywhere near the bathroom or kitchen doors, I will usually tell them I will wait at the bar with a cocktail while I wait for another table.  But tonight, I felt like we lucked out with the best table in the house!  Once seated, we ordered a nice bottle of Cab, and the sausage bruschetta for $10.  Shortly after, we ordered the Complimenti alla Mamma pizza, which consists of Tomato Sauce, Mozzarella, Ricotta, Ham,Salame, Parmigiano Reggiano for $15.  After waiting for what seemed like a longer amount of time than normal for an appy to arrive, the pizza came to our table.  When we brought the issue up to the waiter, he had totally forgot to order it, and immediately put it in for us, and on the house.    The pizza is to die for.  Since then, I have ordered this pizza for take out, and it is amazing every time.  The ricotta is fresh and delicious, the salame and ham bring a saltiness to the pizza, and the crisp crust makes it the best pizza I have had in Arizona.    The total came to $36, not bad for a whole pie, appy, and a nice bottle of red.    I will be walking my little arse here again and again to enjoy this lovely, wood fired pizza.  Only thing is, I dont know if I could even try a different pizza than the Mamma....IT IS SOOOOO GOOOD.  OMG Nom I'm hungry now.  Salivating.  Arrrgg.

y5cQ3_R8x5MhH-yZB2IirA.text: Stopped by on the recommendation from a guy at Su Vino. It's a bit off the beaten track, but the pizzas were terrific, wine was nice and service was pleasant and friendly. We'll definitely come back again. If you don't like dogs, be sure to grab a table inside. Snoopy fell asleep on another patron's lap.

b7gNRYEoJsClsz7q2lgHXA.text: i don't know if it was a slow night, but when we came here last in 2011, you had to wait to be seated, the place would be packed. not so much anymore. i guess that's the life of a scottsdale restaurant.  some things don't change and the nutella banana calzone is just as delicious as ever. service was excellent, and from what i remember, the pizza's are divine!

MXrCrHJxe6fEqlq9fycVow.text: It's a dive italiano spot.  Not in itself a bad thing..  Could use a little sprucing and definitely a little bit of cleaning.  The variety plate appetizer was good - had a few meats, a couple cheeses, artichoke hearts, marinated mushrooms, olives, and some bread.  Good variety, would be great with wine.  We also got the sausage and mushroom pizza.  It tasted a bit of raw flour but other than that it wasn't too bad.  The fennel sausage wasn't too impressive and there was a lot of water coming out of i$t (probably the mushrooms).    All in all, its ok.  Would seek it out, wouldn't avoid it.

kbV8wInjSNxqRoSmXx0j-A.text: A year ago we stumbled upon Grazie and have made it our comfort zone and our jewel.   We have traveled the world, lived in major cities; SF, LA, NYC and we also adore cooking so our dining out is limited to excellent experiences or not pursued.  We also bring friends from all over who visit us, and we have literally had people call us and rave about their experience too...From the amazing pizza to the many salads, (homemade mozzarella!) appetizers and main courses, nothing has disappointed us.  Nothing.  A favorite is to grab a table by the outdoor fire place under the twinkling lights this way we can have our service animal with us in her carrier.  Maurizio is a fabulous chef and Sandy makes everyone feel as if she has known you her entire life.  Guests are treated kindly - and recently Grazie added Russell as chef and we are in a food coma from the last three things he made for us; Fra Diavolo, Chicken Masala and tonights ticket to paradise; the chicken Parmesan chased with a real tiramisu!  The desserts are off the chart.  So, come and bring your friends.  Kick back, sit inside or out - and prepare to be transported to a little slice of heaven.

1bcaFFSYDFS41Ub3pJmW6w.text: Amazing atmosphere and food.  We're in for a wine tasting and it has been amazing.  The food is delicious, the wines are delightful and the service has been extraordinary.   Very happy to have t Hugh is gem in our neighborhood and look forward to our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eqPs-MQXatvPB5ZyiWrf2g.text: Hmm, a bit disappointed. I had been here several times when I used to live in Scottsdale, but that was 3+ years ago, and I must say that I think things have gone downhill here. The bruschetta toppings on the combination platter were odd for the most part, with the exception of the traditional fresh tomatoes and basil, which was delicious and worth mentioning. The provolone on the sausage bruschetta was excessive and the overall combination of flavors just didn't work. The pesto bruschetta was SUPER garlic-heavy, even for someone like me who loves garlic. I couldn't finish either of the latter types of bruschetta.   Onto the main course - pizza. Had the Toscana, which has mozzarella, tomato sauce, mushrooms, and sausage. The crust was burnt and flavorless and the toppings just seemed kind of bland and strangely old-tasting. I mean, not fresh. Weird, I know.   I sort of liked the red sangria, but it was a somewhat odd twist on sangria, as it was pretty sweet and not very strong.   I am sorry, Grazie. I am spoiled by having had the best pizza on earth in Chicago and am too excited to try the other acclaimed pizza joints in Phoenix/Scottsdale to return to your restaurant.

97IgWIWoeMrUL2nVkJf1FQ.text: Meh.. The pizza is barely decent and all 3 times I have been here, part of the crust was burnt to the point were it could not be eaten. Twice with family (they picked the restaurant, once with my fiancee).  The first 2 times with family. The service was decent, until the owner of the place, not only ran out of the wine that my fiancee asked for (Resiling), but in a sad attempt to cover it up, tried to redirect her choice of wines by saying that the Reisling they serve would be much different from what she was used to; as if the owner knew anything about my fiancees experience in wine. After my fiancee declined the few wines the owner kept trying to push, the owner finally admitted that she was out of Reisling. All this over an insulting 3 minute period?  On to the pizza. Burnt Crust and uninspired changes to a centuries old tradition.  We visited this place after coming back from our 3rd trip to Italy (sicily, Rome & Naploli) and wow. Why reinvent the wheel?  Italy has a ton of pizzas, all with individual names. None of the regular Italian named pizzas match up with what they serve at Grazie. They changed everything. An Americana pizza for example has french fries on it. (Strange to us, but normal in Italy. Just an example though) Everywhere in Italy, no matter where you go, if you order an Americana, you will get fries on your pizza. Not so at Grazie. Oh, they have an Americana, but rather than fries, it is completely unrelated to the Italian standard. They made up their own pizzas and named them after typical pizzas found throughout Italy. Nothing matches up.  I ordered the cinque formaggi (in Italy it is the quattro formaggi) Terrible. The entire bottom was burnt, and the cheese was covered in a thin layer of grease. A hint that they use cheap cheese.  Insults, burnt crust and a flare for unoriginal pizzas with the wrong names? No thank you.. I honestly would prefer Papa Johns pizza over this atrocity.

VnjLuD3pUlbmD8xkJDFY5g.text: Oh where to start..... Went here last weekend on a Friday and the place was maybe 10% full. Yet I was asked why I did not have reservations. *looking around* are you serious?? They had like 20 plus tables that were not even a third were filled throughout the whole evening. The patio had so much potential, however having no lighting I was not the only one struggling to see the menu. By the end of the night we were lit by a cell phone glow of people around us trying to read their menus. How romantic!  Drinks: The extremely watered down sangria that tasted like white grape juice with A SINGLE canned peach slice stuck to the bottom. Just nasty. Even the water smelled like mildew and I didn't dare touch the dried out lemons.  Appetizer: My fiance ordered the Fiaggi Misti (meat and cheese assortment, supposedly) It consisted of Oscar Meyer look a like garlic bologna, even worse "sopressatta" that looked like a hunk of fat, and two choices of tiny pieces of dried out cheeses. Oh yes, let us not forget the store bought bread sticks brought out in their packaging still, on top of the assortment still in the damn wrappers, stuck between 3 kalamata olives. What the hell do I do with all the wrappers now? Beyond disgusting. Worst part is that they charge $15 for the damn thing!!   Dinner: Now I enjoy my pizza well done. I just do. Don't ask, just make it happen, ok??! The Toscana pizza that we ordered, was neither well done, and had Wal-Mart quality ingredients. Terrible mozzarella, soggy whole mushrooms, and bland sausage with zero fennel, whatsoever. The sauce was more of a bland paste than a sauce.   Waiting 35+ minutes for the bill when asked several times ensured the zero likely-hood of us ever returning. EVER. But with two servers for the entire place, what did we expect?

Gma962cPHSiONr9lViLQeg.text: Grazie is a special place to me. Each time I go to Grazie, I am greeted by familiar faces in an intimate environment that feels like home.  As a loyal customer, I get the same thing every time. I start off with their fresh bread and olive oil (simple but one of the best around), then I get their signature Cesar salad (honestly the best Cesar salad I have ever had), and then I order the Cinque Formaggi pizza-- a real treat! Grazie has never let me down.

8f-Sp9nIQtKxoeOMqUz7Cw.text: The pizza here is one of my favs. The atmosphere is very romantic in the evenings....lights are dimmed down and candles are lit. I love how small and intimate the establishment is. Pizza is made fresh to order. Waitress has always been super nice. Highly recommend this place!

4NL8FKyKRFR8WH9TuoOmNg.text: After a day of shopping at the local mall and with dinner still hours off, a friend and I popped into Grazie (based on a recommendation from a former Phoenix resident) for a snack.  Didn't hurt that my hotel was just up the street.  After a quick review of the menu, pizza seemed the best option and settled on the Capricciosa (Tomato Sauce, Mozzarella, Artichokes, Olives, Mushrooms, Salame, Ham, Parmigiano Reggian).  The pie emerged from the wood fire oven piping hot, with a slightly burnt crust.  It lasted approximately 5 minutes before vanishing into our hungry bellies.    Wine list is all-Italian and well priced, with many by the glass selections.  I opted for a nice Barbera, which was poured generously into a large glass.  I'd be a regular if living in the area.

4HisHRieRmII1d_R9ZsFag.text: Grazie, I've loved you for so long, but this past weekend sucked!  We had a party of 20 on 8/25 and I am really surprised you assigned a new waitress to our table. Not only did she not know the menu, she offered up a split check when we knew better and were prepared to pay one check. The topper is she couldn't handle splitting the check and freaked out/cried. We did not get it?? Why offer??  Bottles of wine and orders were messed up to a point she started avoiding our table. I am super surprised the owner (yes you behind the wine bar) did not step in sooner. It was a giant mess and an embarrassment to speak so highly and to have the service turn out so terribly.  Your food and wine selection are great, but I hope you fix how you assign new servers. We would have preferred one of your daughters for a big table like ours!  You are not the only place in town with decent pizza. We would appreciate if you could get your service staff together so we can trust your place again!

4mwkyhFtBqxqN0iOfrZo9Q.text: One of our favorite pizzerias: the Vegetariana and Toscana are to die for!! Great outdoor patio too!!

0RXCfJeILX0HtNMHsdYaeg.text: I absolutely love the food and atmosphere but wont be back because the service is painfully slow...You may catch it on a good night but beware if you don't.

5BcBxJv1VI0FKVF8QlbFFw.text: Horribly slow service on a Saturday night. I felt like our server forgot about us. The food and wine was decent, but unfortunately it wasn't enough to outweigh the bad service. My advice is to get more staff, especially on the weekends.

g823A3qnuSxOnowPcqVyug.text: I'm not sure what was better, the sangria or the thin crust pizza but either way- a must see place. The owner has an adorable little dog that sits up at the at bar on a cushion! It is hysterical! I had the vegetarian pizza, a large house salad, and a carafe of the red sangria which made a perfect size meal for my two friends and I.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The little guy at the bar!

u5gTprVdnDxJmNWA9ikmVw.text: The Vesuvio. Half pizza. Half calzone was delicious. Made in authentic wood fired oven using pecan wood. Crusty charred with real Italian meats and wonderful cheeses. Authentico !!!

7KKqgZ_D0vbeSh-SQvFLPQ.text: We love this place! The pizza is by far the best in Phoenix and the wine is delicious. Our favorite pizza is the Capricciosa, though they're all fantastic. The owner is always there and he is so kind. We look forward to going back again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

o2KT5D8ZMi-nIXHB3s6zsw.text: This place is gross. It was understaffed. I was given a super dry, day old chicken in my Ceasar salad. The water made me sick. I am hoping a truly do not have food poisoning but definitely feel sick to my stomach after eating here.  I will not eat here again.

zIYU1-wDYr2hjgV1Oa0dLw.text: Love the outside patio.  We only get another month of this before we go back inside with AC to eat.  Chairs and table were a little dusty, but then again we are outside.  :)  The caprese was very good.  The mozzarella and basil were drizzled in olive oil and great!  The fresh cheese made in house was melts in your mouth.  Yes, I skipped the tomatoes.  Then we had the pizza.  It is was very good, too bad it was a little soggy but the taste of the fresh ingredients made up for it.  OH.  The tiramisu was very very very good.  Not too sweet, the taste of the dessert was not overpowering.  Just right!

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. TOACANA
Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. GRAZIE TIRAMISÚ
Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. CAPRESE

nMh5lEVkGXdMTB0O1T2htg.text: Toscana killer, marg the same, took meatballs to go that were killer later in the micro., love the dog snoopy the owners friend. Laid back joint. Cool

PN5hwNLuUn59ik2cIpFgDA.text: We went here and had the worst service you could imagine. When we ordered bread and olive oil, we waited 20 minutes and only got bread. she never brought the olive oil and threw the pepper down on the table. The waitress could care less about anything . When we talked about the slow response form her to the manager, he wouldn't let me finish and told me how I'm wrong. When my friend steps in the manager started to argue with him. Are you kidding. You won't even listen. Worst service and manger ever. I can't believe how they treat people. Lastly, the waitress tried to charge us double for the bottle of wine we ordered.

juEqtGE7Hdpotzvw8tZgiw.text: easily my favorite place to have Italian food. The most personable and kind staff, very laid back ambiance, and the best most authentic food you can find. Will never pick anywhere else for my birthday dinner!

xT3tdnjzmWdQKBVctg_QPQ.text: This is my go to spot for wine and pizza in old town Scottsdale. The Cappricciosa and the Complimenti ala mamma are hands down the best pizzas in the world. And you must get a glass of the "If You See Kay" wine... you will not regret it!

0y8L_zwV9gbPfwQbTHzdog.text: My wife and I stopped in for a pizza and some wine. Our server was attentive and very friendly. We chose the wine special on the board, not the greatest of choices but reasonable. The pizza was very good, crust was flavorful and cooked perfectly. We will visit again to try more off the menu.

LPHWx0lrIUtPDDnEiXhQbg.text: The spicy pepperoni pizza might be the best pizza I've ever had.  It is a quiet, quaint joint. I wish they had a bit more music or something in the background.  However, the food is delicious.  The owner is always there, and will help with anything.  A hidden gem of Scottsdale.

ijPHfEVtbaQgtVg49_RGVQ.text: The pizza was super soggy and tasted so bad. It actually made me sick. I should have learnd by how many people were in the resturant on a Saturday night when I walked in.... 2 people in total. Wasted $15.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avoid if you dont want to get sick.

cH4ApTv7CgBJU6718rFZQw.text: Dined at Grazie last night and everything was awesome!  Pasta Bolognese and the meatballs are to die for!!! Service was excellent. The staff and our server, Julie were very professional, and friendly. Ended up closing the place down with another bottle of Italian wine!  "Grazie" to the restaurant for such a fun evening!

k3ltBt9tFST6KnV7k0H-pw.text: My favorite Italian style pizza and wine bar. It's distinctly unique in how everything is prepared. The environment is relaxed and cozy. Mauricio and Sandy are both fun to chat with and will always take time away from running the place to chat and see how you're doing.   The flavors are fantastic!  I go with carpaccio or the Caesar Salad (mysteriously delicious) and have a hard time picking between the Complementi alla mama, capriciosa, Dame Edna or the Sofia.   And if you have room for dessert and friends to help out, do not miss the Dulce della casa!

y1jS3J0HuLHq8uBbNc0Rrg.text: DON'T EAT THE PIZZA.  Here's the deal.  Grazie has great pasta, good bread, frozen beer mugs, decent wine, good service, and good apps.  BUT.  They roll out their pizza dough with a rolling pin.   Everything else about the pizza was spot on.  The sauce, the cheese, the toppings.   But,  the dough.  They kill it.  Repeatedly. With a pin. Sigh.  Go for the pasta and bread.  Leave before the pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The pizza.   Good, but not good.
Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Frozen beer mug!!

nPWedILgsnylZ8AICmDNlQ.text: Amazing food and the environment was warm, cozy and very welcoming!  We will be back!  Yummy!

MTzAik1vOXbwVUZdeV3xhw.text: My boyfriend and I visited Grazie while staying at a nearby hotel. Things started off really well, but the fact that we were the only ones in the restaurant should have been a hint.  We each ordered a pizza - the waiter (who was also the one to cook the pizza) repeated back our order, which was not at all complicated...just a cheese pizza and a pepperoni pizza. However he brought me my cheese pizza and never returned with my boyfriend's pizza. Not only that, but he proceeded to sit at the bar and drink with someone else who I believe was the owner or manager, and they watched a soccer game and completely ignored us.  We finally got his attention and just asked for the check, and went to a different place down the street to get my boyfriend's lunch. If we ever stay in this area again, we will definitely be avoiding this place. Zero customer service.  And for what it's worth, my pizza was burnt.

sADpduhjdIbwOuMI0wIiJA.text: I have been going to this place for years and it is one of my favorite pizza places in the valley. It is always consistent , the variety is good, the service is always excellent, most importantly, they treat you like family.

1Ae1OINiUjAFG3l1hBhsGA.text: We were walking and looking at menus on a Saturday evening and the hostess opened the door and invited us in - we're glad she did.  Family dinner started with bread, had the Meatball special, which is a must try as it melts in your mouth, Chicken Parm, Margherita pizza and a nice glass of wine. Our server was super attentive and very friendly. Costs were overall reasonable. We will visit again when back in the area.

z4MkZ0ReDvfAJDwNfvsARA.text: Grazie is one of my favorite spots for pizza, Italian food, and wine in old town. I've been coming here for a couple years and I've never been disappointed. The service is excellent and the food is top notch. I especially enjoy their revolving wine menu, and I highly recommend visiting one of their wine tasting events.

aEzkGG0q_pfCGj5zjkbVGw.text: Sucks.   We used to like Grazie. They were way ahead of the game years ago with delicious pizzas and salads that smacked of genuine Italian authenticity and could be counted on for a nice meal.  It's been a few years though since visiting snd tonight I ordered a pizza to go. Simple stuff.   We ordered the the "Sofia" which the menu said included Smoked Mozzarella, Parmigiano Reggiano and Prosciutto. I specifically asked for a well done pizza.   The pie we received for almost $20 however was a tasteless disappointment. The prosciutto was sliced so thick that it was literally like luncheon meat on the pie - heavy and inedible. I've never seen prosciutto on a pizza sliced so poorly. It was globbed all over the pie haphazardly - a mess.   Our pie was underdone - not well done.   The dough was bland and flavorless.  I feel bad because Grazie used to be dependable and was a charming place. Now - it feels like it's winding down and over.   The pizzas at North Italia are far superior.   Cibo downtown (who apparently used to be partners with the Grazie owner years ago) is eons better than this once delicious dining spot.   Ciao Grazie, we won't be back.

X_rcI0ywnxzWN463YD3eUw.text: Went here as a party of 3 adults and one toddler on a Friday night. We were told as we were seated that a bunch of parties came in at once so expect a wait for your food. Okay, but could you please slap some pasta and tomato sauce in a small bowl for the toddler at least.?! No, apparently this was too difficult. An hour and 10 minutes later we finally get our food. We were apologized to numerous times, but really?? It's a Friday night in Scottsdale...you should know you were going to be busy. Maybe throw in a free desert or something for our long wait. Food was alright...chicken parm and margherita pizza were tasty. The eggplant parm ordered was already sold out by 730pm. I had to settle for a spicy pasta dish that was mediocre. And the toddler dish seemed like it could have easily been slapped in a bowl 70 minutes prior. For the lack of service, please go elsewhere. Plus, you can find much better pizza elsewhere.

C8zBgkyg9PO5AskAa4mexg.text: Horrible service.  Saturday afternoon visit.  There was one person at the bar and one other table with customers.  There was nobody there to greet us, so we sat ourselves after having trouble finding a clean table.  After a few minutes the waiter came by and tossed a couple menus on our table.  We sat for 15 minutes and finally got up to leave.  The waiter approached us as we were leaving, so we told him we had been sitting for 15 minutes with no service.  This is when it got interesting as he proceeded to tell me how busy he was and was confrontational with me and even questioned my intelligence!  Pretty crazy and very unprofessional treatment.  Needless to say, we will not be back and would not recommend!

YDFSItQm3_yMD4_t6w79kA.text: Yummy. Great food, great wine.  If you haven't been to Italy, but want to enjoy a really authenticeal Italian meal, check out Grazie. Authentic Italian food and imported wines.

ztVWxpZjf_4aL7J4jUPVlA.text: Went to Grazie Pizzeria today at 2:30PM with my wife and 5 year old daughter (well after the 12PM rush). They had 2 or 3 people working and no one even came out to seat us for at least 5 minutes. Once we were seated, another 5 minutes went by until someone (a busboy, I think) even acknowledged us and brought menus. 15 minutes later, still no one acknowledging us (mind you, lots of empty, un-bussed tables, no visible wait staff, owner milling around inside) so we got up and left, completely unnoticed. Unbelievable neglect for any business whose #1 priority needs to be its customers.

2ejrJAmy-LPbhSlS8dIe_Q.text: Yum, yum, yum ... Can't believe it took me so long to get here!  My girl Toni has been telling me to get my fanny here for some time and now I understand!  I've been here twice now with the bf and its been a hit both times. We've had 3 of the pizzas and the bruschetta assortment between our 2 visits. I am a big fan of that 5 cheese pizza... the sweet, mild ricotta, provolone and the tangy gorgonzola are a hit with the usual mozzarella and parmesan.  If you see one, pick up the Groupon for a pitcher of sangria and pizza for only $15; its a steal!!  We've had their red sangria on both visits and I'm not sure we'll ever be brave enough to try the white ... the red is that good!  There's no music that I recall and only one small tv, so its nice to not have your date distracted by a sporting event. ;)  Its a small restaurant, but they have lots of patio seating that is sure to be a hit with the weather cooling off!  Highly recommend this spot for date night or casual dinner with a group of friends.

ufQomF4RMx2K0LSByoDwXQ.text: Came with a group of friends, and sat outside.  Several of their outdoor heaters weren't working, but we made do.  I had the Fornarina Caprese - imagine a thin pizza crust with a pile of chopped caprese salad on top.  Tasty, but a little heavy handed on the seasoning.  Portions were generous all around, food came out pretty quickly considering the number of people we had (about 12 or 13).

a-m9w7ayrWtoR7Uxda9vtw.text: My experience with Grazie was short and sweet.  After settling into the Valley Ho, the BF had to do some work, so I set out in search of some nearby takeaway. The Tortilla Factory was closed but Grazie was just down the street. Knowing he'd had his heart set on Mexican, I stood and examined the menu outside trying to decide whether to keep walking. Just then a car pulled up, then a couple got out and walked past me. A second later, though, the gentleman turned around and came back to tell me, "Everything's great here. You should try it." Sold.  I ordered a panino, then went to sit outside on the patio while I waited. There was a fireplace on the far end, and I could see how it would nice to sit outside on a cooler evening. The proprietor brought my check and promised the panino would be ready soon. He was right, and I was on my way back to the hotel after a few more minutes, switching the takeout container from hand to hand because it was so heavy.  The Romano panino was enough for us to share and was really tasty. The pizza crust-like flatbread sandwiched mortadella, provolone, and sliced tomatoes. There was even a little side salad and some olives, which was a nice surprise.   I'd love to go back here to put the rest of the menu to the test, but I have a feeling that gentleman was right when he said, "Everything's great."

a65isjYLWpJZq1SHKWU4Lg.text: We took family from out-of-town here a few years ago and their pizza was wonderful.  We thought we would try it again for lunch today around 11:30.  We ordered the Giardiniera but was told they were out of the grilled vegetables as the truck had not yet come in so we had to settle for the Vegetariana.  The pizza oven had not been turned on yet so it was quite a wait.  The pizza was quite bad... crust was soggy in the center and the outside crust started out slightly crispy but turned soft like bread within minutes.  Worst of all, the bottom was caked with a lot of the black ash from previous usage.  We don't mind a little as is atypical of wood-fired ovens but this was a lot that dominated and killed the taste.  The onions were overly sweet like sugar had been added.  There was only 1 other couple in the place but the service was under par as well.  Our water glasses were not refilled.  Thankfully, we were not asked if we wanted a box for the leftover pizza.  There was a large puddle of water in the hallway close to the restrooms.  Frankly, we don't know what the explanation is for this poor experience.  We see all the good reviews.  We will not be returning to or recommending Grazie.  The owner who was serving us was nice and pleasant.

arkjd4k4ORz8RMR7MuYkhA.text: We had a Groupon for Grazie and were very pleased with the service and food. Their sangria was phenomenal and we loved the pizza! Their outdoor patio space was beautiful and quaint too. A nice oasis in Downtown Scottsdale.

lrf4U794Qxs0Iw6QVqoDkQ.text: Average Food but that is about it. Everything is overpriced. Bread was cold. Pizza was ok. Sangria was more juice less wine. Place is dark and dingy. There was only one server who was very nice and attentive even though she was overworked.   Overall, avoid it.

-9BieLo6FTE1OI4h29aLxA.text: I took a date here as we both heard good things about it and both of us were craving wine and pizza. We ordered the Marcello (mozzarella, garlic, tomatoes, Parmesan) and the Vegetariana (mozzarella, provolone, caramelized onions and roasted red peppers). We both agreed that the pizzas were just okay, nothing great. It didn't have a lot of flavor and not enough toppings. It wouldn't come close to my top ten pizza places in the city. The restaurant was cool as there were a lot of places to sit outside as well as in. The wine selection was pretty decent as well.   Not a fan of the food but maybe I went on an off night. I plan on giving it another shot and possibly order a different pizza with more toppings.

JuFzKu-WtEIFURYAcWyTeQ.text: The best Pizza on the planet. The staff is friendly and helpful. If you love the taste of Italy, you need to visit this restaurant!

ic5mXDNL2YHkmh48Ls8QJg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE Grazie - very cool pizza and wine bar in Old Town.  The pizza is fresh and delicious.  Their Italian wines are interesting and reasonably priced.  Their nutella dessert calzone is to die for.

XNB3OB8EjhCjdvJoX8OGfQ.text: Great thin crust pizza comparable to what i have had in Italy. Off the beaten path but so worth it. Beautiful outdoor seating and a huge wine list, great for a date or night out with friends.

UmC9aM-Q7wDJGdZibaZaGA.text: we used a groupon, we could not justify the cost without it. we watch our money and don't  eat out expensively.  but we like trying new things, especially if they are authenticate, which i'm sure this was.  it wasn't busy, just after noon on saturday. the owner was business like even though he knew he wasn't going to make a lot of money with such cheap people.  the pizza was very new to me, apparently wood fired oven, very thin crust, very little tomato, very little cheese, eggplant and other vegies. i liked the flavor, but i'm large and the pizza was small. i've obviously adapted to american style food- lots of mass, little in taste.  i'd love to be able to cook at home like this. i'm going to try. maybe that is the best thing to happen there, i'd like to cook like he did.  thank you to the owner for running the groupon, i hope residents can discover his authenticate taste with them and return. for us it was a major splurge.  nice sangria. glad driver limited to very little. too sweet to taste alcohol content.

-8mvLH7dsKaIBCy76kOJgA.text: Grazie is one of two go-to restaurants for the bestie & myself.  We've been coming here for a few years now, all times of day and all times of year.  We always try to aim to sit on the patio, it's uber cute and relaxing.  We started off ordering salads, and while they're okay, I'm glad we bit the carb bullet and started ordering their pizzas. Now we always go straight for the pizza and our favorite wine (they're the only ppl we've found in town that have it by the bottle, to purchase, and by the glass. sorry I can never remember the name - I rely on her!).  Our most recent visit included about 10 others, and once again, didn't disappoint. One girl ordered that desert calzone for everyone... Baked pizza dough filled with bananas and Nutella? With mounds of vanilla ice cream on top? HOLY HECK! This is what heaven must taste like!

xLfzjoOxGe92GShJJGybOw.text: OMG! I am still full from pigging out on pizza, wine, and more pizza. If you left that place hungry after this event then that was your own fault because the food was endless!! Endless!!!!  See The AZWinebats and Grazie were hosting a wine event that was only $20 for 8 wine tastings and endless amounts of pizza and salads.  I started off with a free sampling of the Bruschetta Salsiccia, which was Italian Fennel Sausage with Melted Provolone Bruschetta YUM! I then had another bruchetta that was a cream cheese base with some sweet carmelized onions, red peppers, and seasonings which was equally as good as the Bruschetta Salsiccia. From there I moved on to the fabulous pizza that varied from the Margherita, Vegetariana, Americana, and Toscana. With all that pizza plus the yummy salads that they had to choose from where were the Emiliana and the Cesar, see now you realize why I am still full. I pigged out like there was no tomorrow. The Vegetariana won me over because of the sweet carmelized onions. Double yum!  The wine tasting was pretty good with my favorite being the one from Bigi called the Orvieto Amabile. It was a sweet white wine and that is just how I like my white wines. My next favorite was the Rosso di Podernovo from Castello Dell Regine and rounding it out with the Sangiovese Riserva from Umbeito Cesari being my favorite red and was also the last one on the list. The one that I did not like was the Brut Rose from Hello Kitty. Not a favorite but hey you can't like them all now can you?  My favorite part of the day was the fact that my friend Mark T. surprised me by coming to this event. Especially since he lives way in the middle of BFE!! LOL sorry Mark. But seriously, it was a great surprise and I was so very happy that he was there. Mark you rock!!  The owner was fantabulous, the staff were fantabulous, the food was fantabulous, the company was AMAZING!!! (thank you again Mark)What can I say, I am a happy and very full woman. (hmm pizza and wine drool....)  PS! The next event is Feb 28, so if you are in the area, by all means check it out. For $20, you can't beat it!

LFU96zot2V522-IXV09_uw.text: Used Groupon yesterday...waste  of time & $$$., Thought we'd hit Happy Hr, but the place was empty @  330P except for the owner & a small dog seated on bar stool. Acted like we were bothering  him.  Cute place but looked like it could use a good cleaning which is not a good feeling when you are about to order food.  There were 3 carafes of , Sangria already sitting at the bar...the Groupon was for pizza & sangria.  We asked for a gass of vino instead ?  No substitutions! , So, we were served warm sangria...we asked for ice.  The pizza. was disappoinying too..left half of it.  Mayb its better later in the evening?  Mayb they 're tired of Groupon customers?  Not my probloni...wont go back.

1hBar5PhgoIIy4GsQMqwlw.text: I love this place. My second time there, was lucky enough to go on a Groupon.  It is small and quaint with a secret find type of atmosphere. We had the 2 pizza's and a calzone. The calzone is the best I ever had (and I'm from NY and don't really even love them). The Edna pizza (arugula, proscuitto, and shaved parm reggiano) is wonderful. Great crust, everything is just YUMMY!

HsLIkj77d13pxmp8DyR-QA.text: Great pizza! I came here twice, both times with a Groupon, and was not disappointed. I had tomatoes and really enjoyed their caprese salad. I've tasted the Americana and Cinque Formaggi which were both great. I especially love the atmosphere and the patio is perfect when the weather is right. It is somewhere I have highly recommended since and will certainly visit again.

DE10YLi7RyT0oanUMrpu1w.text: This place is fairly good. Service was somewhat slow, but I think that they were short staffed. My husband had the pizza/calzone combination and LOVED it. We'd go back again.

J9LKBRZNyF4eiBi70SyPlw.text: The food was good, but the service was awful. First, they need a hostess because we walked in and stood around waiting awkwardly for someone to seat us.   After we sat down it took 15 minutes before we were greeted. We literally had our order ready and waiting. Anyways, the food was great but the service was sloppy: I was served wine before my girlfriend, they did not bring a chiller for the bottle, and our server was MIA until the check came.   They can definitely be a legit spot, but they just need to clean up there act.

pWRQGuju3kgo8hSyn9MWaw.text: I really dig this place - its a small, charming place that isn't overdone and doesn't take itself too serious...definitely a romantic vibe, and a nice break from a lot of the Old Town restaurants.   The wine prices are super cheap, in part because they sell wine for retail prices, and they'll usually let you sample a few wines before you pick your bottle for the evening.  For food, I love the house salad with gorgonzola dressing - I'd buy the gorgonzola dressing by the bottle if I could. For pizza, the vegetarian or the 5 cheese pizza are both great - if you love cheese, definitely go for the 5 cheese (cinque formaggi).  We've been a few times now and will be back again soon.

7TUnA9-6_ATiv_jyywF-sA.text: I love everything about this place.  The pizza is inventive, simple and delicious.  The atmosphere is cool and relaxed.  The food is incredible and their wine selection ain't bad either.  Their dessert calzone with Nutella and bananas is fantastic.  Whenever I'm in Phoenix, Grazie Pizzeria is at the top of my list!!!

hO15vTgpxy5PizT2jL5z5A.text: The staff here sometimes isn't the friendliest or the fastest but the good food and the cute patio keeps me coming back. I first tried this place after getting a groupon for it so now I always keep my eye out hoping they so it again. Their pizzas are amazing and they have some different toppings. They have great sangria and the best part if the dessert. They have a chocolate Nutella calzone that they bake in their wood fire and it is hands down one of my favorite desserts, it has car mailed bananas in it and just is heavenly!

ahXwAnKDyD8SAGL35xapCQ.text: What I love about Grazie....  1) It's in the old town area so you can go out after, but not  an "old town touristy"  restaurant which I like. 2) Sunday wine tasting!!!  Usually around $20 and you get apps, maybe 5 tastings and to sit outside. 3) Sausage bruschetta 4) You can enjoy the company of your friends without getting hassled to eat & leave. 5) Nutella calzone with vanilla bean ice cream!!! love love love

AcKmk4i5bytfeSFsXr4R-g.text: Incredible pizza, great ambiance and terrific service.   We really enjoyed this Old Town spot next to the Poisoned Pen Bookstore. We split an Emiliana salad at the recommendation of the owner followed by an Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza. Both were excellent as was the selection of wines.   I thought I'd order a Sangiovese as it was lunch, and I wanted something light. They brought out 3 wines to try and we ended up going with a Tuscan Cabernet blend which was terrific.   This place makes the list of "spots to go back to" in Scottsdale! Great service, great food and really nice ambiance!

VJVsCQG328dCD-zNHOae1A.text: Absolutely the worst slow service. Food is mediocre. One meal served - still waiting for a pizza an hour later. Waiter very unapologetic. The restaurant is not that crowded and does not look understaffed. Very painful when you have a starving 9 year old.

1Wr6MwY2JW-Hvxms5qCKYA.text: Delicious  Have been here twenty times and have had only one time where it wasn't great. Great outdoor patio.  Also have great wine tastings that are reasonable and a lot of fun on Saturdays and Sunday.    Friendly owner that works very hard to make his restaurant one of the best in Scottsdale.

t-wKde63fhCSAEAwv1j2sQ.text: One of my favorite pizza places! They use lots of cheese (which I love) and fresh ingredients. This place is special since I went on the first date with the bf there.  Luckily they had lots of white pizza options because that's the only type of pizza I eat otherwise we might not still be dating. But seriously its really good. Nice patio for when the weather is cooler. Romantical.

CIb82bjDA4dGASLeShgTfg.text: Some seriously tasty pizza.  Felt like I was back in Italy again.  Love that they have pizza marinara listed right on the menu, which is an excellent option for vegan folks!

Vj4laW7EYgxK4WqboxPJoQ.text: The food here is great, but I'm inspired to review the place because of the service.  Last weekend my wife and I were in town for just a couple days.  We were hungry late one night and Grazie had been recommended by a friend.  As we arrived we realized they were nearing closing time and asked if we should come back another day.  The staff insisted, "No, no.  Come in."  I'd had a bad experience in a similar situation at another restaurant in the past, so I was still a bit hesitant.  But, decided to give it a shot anyway.  The staff at Grazie was top notch.  My wife and I received great service, the hour being completely irrelevant.  Heck, our server even broke out his smartphone and looked up a nearby late night frozen yogurt shop for us.  Five stars for service, Grazie!

ek2-3ey26xCvVLdReQFmcA.text: We only went to Grazie because we had a Groupon. This was the filthiest restaurant I have ever been too. Every table was COVERED with dirty dishes and food. Our pizza was horrible. I would have rather had a frozen pizza at home. Never again.  I am sorry for the harsh review but it was really that bad.

mwYHB9rUEzWS3useQepGxA.text: My wife and I tried this place out on a Groupon, which entitled us to a pitcher of sangria and a pizza.  Unfortunately, after waiting 25 minutes from the time we were seated, I had to hunt down a manager to get a server to even stop by our table!  After that, he service was ok, but not great.  The pizza was good, and while the sangria wasn't the best I've had, it was large enough to be almost too much!  I'm not sure if I would go back or not.

ddn-d1XNueRsn946NDaRoA.text: One of the best pizza places in town, if not the best. Great friendly service, they make you feel at home. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews on this place, those people are crazy and obviously have a stick up you know where.

awr3Okq5ADBsn2qsbj2lkg.text: Best pizza in town. Grazie's is fantastic. I have had pizza all over the place and this is a good place. The owner is always around greeting people and serving wine, the pace is very cute and really the food is great. The pizza is very good and True to Neapolitan pizza! He use to use 00 flour but now uses regular and the quality IMO did not change that much to not go back. Nothing more I can say except this is real pizza. Pizzeria Bianco which is suppose to be all this and that is a Joke, the lines are stupid, the people are stupid, stupid for waiting and I can say it is not as good as grazies plus you get right in to enjoy the pizza!  Dont' waste your time with other places, this is it.

WRWINs_kRTS-WZaW0xFV5A.text: Delicious!! Had a Margherita with mushrooms. Everything was fresh. Salad with the mix was amazing too.

4q9shdO9Xlq0fm-gBhE3Rg.text: I used to love this place. I still love the food. The Americano is an amazing pizza. But the service has really slipped. I'm not sure why there's only one waitress for a Friday night. Maybe someone quit or called in sick. But the owner was trying his best to keep up with inside customers and the outdoor waitress couldn't keep up with her three tables. And two parties of ten plus people showed for their reservations. What happened to the rest of the staff?

czo_gMHNS0gLlrEpSkFAYQ.text: Went here last night when on our last night staying at the Hotel Valley Ho.  We were able to walk there from the hotel and it was so cute.  The wait staff were helpful and gracious.  Once we saw how large the pizzas were, they accomodated us and split the toppings on each side of the pizza so we got what we wanted.  I did think the olives were really salty, but that's that type of olive.  We had delicious wine and the bruschetta sampler.  Enjoy people!

l20K-DUqrL2tFUOsigyfaQ.text: As much as I respect Michael C.'s reviews, I'm not going to give Grazie 4 - 5 stars just because.  The last time my wife and I visited Grazie, we received terrible, unattentive service, and a soggy, less-than-tasty Margherita pizza.  And I'm not trying to exaggerate either - we actually wanted to send the pizza back.  I love the idea of a small, nearby, locally owned pizzeria like Grazie, so we'll probably try going there again.  The atmosphere is just what I want a dinner place - dark and intimate - but they have to have good food and service, too.

EUiBJJagZAZc9B8RAWZc3A.text: get the pizza and sangria! The owner is amazing, True Italian and brought us an amazing nutella dessert!   mangia!

9Ljdma87a-eiiBVZOk241A.text: Fantastic food and great service.  We had the eggplant,  meatball and Vesuvio and all were great.  Got the melted cheese appetizer which was also good, but hard to eat!!  I would rate the food and service five star...the only thing I think could use improvement was the atmosphere.   Clean and good music, but a bit dark for my liking.  And the crumpled paper menus were odd.  I expected a bit fancier restaurant based on the location,  but everything else made up for that.  We recommend!!

zYD03ehVqWMErpSmFeisZw.text: Walked in the front door, waited for someone to greet us, waited...waited then finally some older lady sat us outside in a dark corner and said she wouldn't light the candle then walked away...sat sat sat sat for 10 mins before she came back and asked if we wanted drinks. Said we wanted a lighted table and she made a smartass comment and was rude. She asked if we're sure we wanna stay and we left. Won't ever be back..called to speak to the manager and an older man with an accent refused to put a manager on the phone and hung up. Wow such great service

gfMS8tIAKdhb2bAFQiTbXw.text: We have been here dozens of times. Love this place! We always get the Complimenti Alla Mamma pizza and a salad. Service is always great and everything is authentic which you don't find in AZ very often. I've made reservations and the owner is always the one who picks up the phone and is so kind and friendly a This is definitely a hidden gem and I would highly recommend it.

aPpiEKz_g1F5lVJr-L9lUg.text: I'm worried for anyone who plans on having a nice dinner here. Save yourself because the waitstaff seems to be Netflix binging in the back. I think if you want to have an hour convo with someone without being interrupted, this might be your place. Also, if you don't want water refills or food this is the spot for you.

T_t3WDdWYoersicHrqpv4A.text: You know you're in an authentic Italian restaurant when the owners buddies are hanging out at the bar with the owners dog as well. AND, all are speaking Italian, well except for the poodle. In fact one of the owners doesn't speak English, so that of course added to the authentic feel as well.   I was visiting some friends, and Yvonne has lived in Scottsdale since she was a toddler, and she strongly suggested a visit here. She knows I prefer ma n pa places over large shiny corporate owned restos. Well she nailed it on this small friendly family run outfit. We arrived close to closing time on a Friday night, so it was a very relaxed vibe with the few remaining patrons and staff chatting with each other and us. The owner(?) lady overheard a part of our conversation and joined in. Funny lady!   We desired just a late-night pizza, and Yvonne ordered the Capricciosa made with artichokes, Kalamata Olives, mushrooms, spicy salame, and ham. The wood fired crust was cooked perfectly and the crust was very flavorful. All ingredients tasted fresh and of high quality. One very tasty pie!   Great spot in Old Town Scottsdale. Mille grazie, Grazie!

RKWqau_AP7ZC7LVihHmaag.text: Grazie is a super cute pizza place on the outskirts of old town Scottsdale! The atmosphere is nice; they have a brick oven, a good-size patio, and a cute poodle pup sleeping by the bar. To start we ordered the burrata. It's listed as a salad but it has very little lettuce. It's mostly delicious burrata with a thick and sweet balsamic sauce. We also ordered the Toscano pizza. The crust and sauce were perfect! But the toppings weren't my favorite. It had way too many mushroom and the fennel sausage lacked flavor, making the pizza bland overall.

iWMmiDMYhxC_CPzA3akr8w.text: Pizza is definitely no Gramaldies.  Atmosphere was alright, server was helpful.  Pizza was ok however sangria was bottom shelf at best with no fruit like was stated earlier. Will not be back without the groupon with these prices for what you get.

6E5WJQiwbBzRFx4PhgwtQQ.text: If you want to feel like you were just picked up and dropped into Italy then Grazie is the place to go. The atmosphere, food and wine is so Italian. Why spend money on a flight to Italy when you can just go to Grazie. If all you want is an American pizza then go down the street. But if you want real Italian food then go to Grazie.

oa3Ad_XwHJj0TwQuUT0XDQ.text: The best Italian food in Scottsdale and the service is fantastic, if you're looking for a night out with great food and service look no further.

w3LiMaef9IWlpYP3YhiVMA.text: I just took a party of 20 at Grazie Saturday night and it was simply amazing. Everyone is still talking about the great food, wine, ambiance, and excellent service. I think we ordered everything on the menu. The meatballs, pizza, lasagna, salad, and everything else we had for dinner was impeccable.

zP5OZtZyGjn3DX9qXN_Wrg.text: Sandi and crew did another great job tonight. We moved further away from Old Town a few years ago and haven't been here in a while, but it was as great as we remembered it from when used to frequent this place a number of years ago. We'll be back again soon for sure. Great pizza, great wine, great owners.

XKhaaB8zl6ol9cRhVeGqXQ.text: This was the absolute worst service and food I have ever experienced.  Went with a small group (5) and we were the ONLY customers in the restaurant.  Now I know why! It took over 1 hour to get the 3 different pizzas we ordered & when they finally arrived, 1 was charred to black and all were tasteless.  A person from our group expressed dissatisfaction with an individual believed to be the manager (an older woman wearing sunglasses) and her response was "well, then don't leave a tip". Wow! Terrible service and equally terrible food!

8qlCwqYuHWiqZuj0l2NsyA.text: Last night we attended the wine dinner and it was amazing! Five delicious Italian wines paired with generous food portions. The service was perfect, attentive without over doing it. You are missing out if you are not going to Grazie! Romantic, fun and very friendly spot.

Y95ji6UUhSbXwEfw25AEKw.text: Great local, authentic, Italian with lovely and accommodating owners. Highly recommend.

U5MhTPiCDPZJdHbxvL3N0Q.text: Best pizza I've ever had, and I'm from New York, where we are very smug about our pizza. Why was it the best?  Enough tomato sauce(lately I get too much cheese and not enough sauce very often), right thickness of crust, and stupendous ingredients in the right amount, meaning generous. I had the Capricciosa, which is everything you should want on a pizza...artichoke hearts, excellent Kalamata olives, ham, and salami, just right. The texture was a little "wet", as it should be. Truly a standard-setting pizza. My wife had the lasagne, also outstanding. Sat outside by the fireplace. So happy to have found this place. Waitress Jules made it all even better. Only our second night in Arizona, we shall be back here!!

cGlJIBq8M6jQ-B45prS38w.text: Had a delicious Toscana pizza at Grazie, on a laid-back, quiet Sunday night. My server, Jewels, more than lived up to her name! The pizza dough and the cheese are exceptional. I sat outside, so I don't know first-hand what the scene is like inside, except Jewels told me that they show old movies on the TV at the bar, which I love! Would definitely come back. I read some less than flattering reviews, including one where someone complained that they didn't serve food fast enough for her toddler. Go somewhere with a children's menu!

FT2p1BxweCJYaCn0bYQHzQ.text: When you walk into this little, quaint building in Scottsdale, take note of the artwork displayed on the walls. Our server confessed that the colorful beauties were her own creation.  The chefs in the back are definitely as talented as she is. This dough is addicting. Thin, but not cracker style, and the toppings are dynamite. We had the Gardinera pizza, and they were very polite to to take the cheese off to accommodate our Vegan requests. The marinara sauce was sweet and fresh, and our veggies were delightful.  Our meat eating companions enjoyed a very delicious smoked mozzarella appetizer with mushrooms and prosciutto on top. I would have taken a picture, but the dish was already half-eaten by the time I got my camera out!  All in all, the service was very pleasant. Our server loved chatting art with me, and she gave us very insightful advice as to where else to go for our trip. The food was AHMAZING. Pizza connoisseurs will appreciate the love and craft that goes into each delicious slice.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The veggie Gardinera pizza!!!

cf4bPpOgpBGRPXZPCj3CMQ.text: Not good- a lousy pizza w/ soggy crust! Service- it's a one man show, taked the order,bakes the pizza, brings it to the table and you are on your own while he BS'ing at the Bar w/ his buddy. Got screwed because I paid $45 for two of us and left the food on the table and left. Place Looks tired and dirty- does not look snappy!
