fYAuc4ZA3I_7_4p6XGTMvA.text: Food was mediocre. Service was the worst I've ever experienced in my 39 years of eating out at restaurants. We were a party of 13. The waitress seemed really oblivious and out of it. She was very clueless about the menu and kept forgetting what we were saying to her. To be quite honest it looked like she was high on drugs. She brought my salad and main course together first. Then she brought my husbands salad and main course together as well. We ate alone with our other 11 family members waiting on their food. She then started bringing one plate at a time with 10 minutes in between each plate. I've failed to mention that we were the only table there. So it took her about an hour to bring out 13 people's food all separate. We were all shocked. The worst thing of all was that the owner was sitting there at the bar the whole time and didn't do one thing about it. He was sitting there counting money and watching tv. Towards the end we waited for our bill for a while and she charged us incorrectly so we had to wait even more time until she got it right. When we finally decided it was time to complain the the owner started yelling at us like crazy. He told us to never come back again. That is exactly what we will do and I urge you to do the same.

FhDmjgHKQhW8Ht2BxoIerw.text: The food is incredible. Looks like it a family owned and run. The service is a bit on the slow side yet everyone was very nice

yBAajU-LK3PozNdQJXI0sQ.text: Grazie's food is great! The servers are very kind and well-versed in the menu. The appetizers are very delicious.. Their Caesar Salad is particularly fantastic. You cannot go wrong with any of their pizzas.. I really like the Sofia and the Cinque Formaggi.   Grazie is honestly one of the best restaurants in the Greater Phoenix Area. Very comfortable and nice atmosphere.. Delicious food. Good service. Highly recommend Grazie to anyone interested in an exceptional meal.

wPNnrMgG17TLCntEf_FYDQ.text: I am a big fan and loyal customer of Grazie! They have an amazing staff, great selection of wines and their salads and pizza are incredible! The ambience is great whether I come in by myself, with my family or on a date. I highly recommend Grazie for the best Italian food in town.

7i8U6eECb9PvLLpUD_VhwA.text: Amazing Italian wood fired pizzas (favs are the complimenti alla mama & the Americana+ricotta cheese). Make sure to save room for dessert - BEST pizza crust calzone filled with Nutella and bananas topped with ice cream.... never had anything better. the Emiliana salad is amazing as well. Great wine selection... great staff. This is my husband's and my favorite spot :)

wVNeHSWhUWaJ1vIagqKM8g.text: I have never had such terrible service as we received at this place. We got there around 5 and we had a couple groupons. No where on the groupons did it say one per table ( I think they were for a pizza and some wine). The waitress gave us total attitude about using them. She finally allowed us to use 2 of the 3 ( we had 8 people).  It took her almost an hour to take our order and then she told us we could not leave off any of the toppings on the pizza because they only had one cook and she wasn't going to confuse him (we wanted mushrooms left off one pizza, difficult and confusing I know). After another hour we finally received our pizza. We decided to try dessert which took us another hour to get.  Never once did she refill my coke or offer drinks to anyone else at the table. At 9 we had to leave and could wait no longer for the check so we gave the group we were with some cash and left. They said it took another half hour at least for them to pay and leave. 4 Hours for pizza and dessert is nuts!!     The waitress gave us attitude the entire time. So much so that we are still teasing the girl who arrived there first about what on earth she could have done to have angered the waitress before we got there. PS. She didn't do anything, she didn't even have a drink when we arrived.  By the way I love dogs! I have had one all my life and even volunteered at humane societies. However, when I go into a restaurant the last thing I want to see is a dog sitting on a chair at the bar with his head on the bar. Gross!  Never again.

ZMq9cG4y5g3u_EATYXnVuw.text: Ate here for the first time this weekend. First of the 95+ degree weather and we saw misters on their patio! DONE! It was nice and breezy and with the water mist we felt relaxed  eating outside.   I have to give props to our server who was taking orders AND cooking, I believe he was the owner.   The food was delicious, I got the calzone (all cheese) the $5 sangria was great, after 1 glass I walked away a little tipsy. Perfect after noon lunch place!

HhInbZeyV4WNtaSDAXaYWg.text: Worst service I have received in a long time.  We were a party of four.  After waiting 20 minutes to order, we were told that we were given the lunch menu but that they would let us order anyway.  Then our server switched, but failed to tell the new server our order.  Once he put it in, another 20 minutes later, we were told we could have a sandwich and we need to order something else.  They also didn't have any white sangria left and told us they were too busy to make more.  Don't waste your time.  Grimaldi's up the street has better food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Slow service results in no food yet!

7lDxrZALeU-yUIn5rqycRg.text: We really enjoyed the Insalata della Casa with Balsamic Vinaigrette and the Toscana pizza, we really enjoy a thin "cracker" like crust. The white Sangria was a disappointment though, it was not very sweet and tasted weak & watered down.  All in all a good dining experience. We will return to try out other fare.

iU5Pd97gP3X4-MgGTQY89A.text: If you want REAL Neapolitan pizza baked in a REAL 800F+ oven to perfection... eat here. If you want a bready mess of a "pizza" go somewhere else.  We had the cinque formaggio pizza and it was divine. One of the best pizzas I have ever eaten.  If you want a great selection of wines by the glass, this is also a nice place.  The service was very casual and nice as well.

_WVnXAzH61LNVQgaq-33hg.text: Loved our server Alexandra. She knows her menu and wine. Best Italian food I've had here in Scottsdale.

UsBI6Mon2KQgc6eP5AFrVw.text: Amazing food! Great atmosphere! I've been in town for only a few days and I've already been here twice.  The emiliana salad is incredible.  I will definitely be back next time I am in town.

LF3SrwrLtrWclxJ7CcSq3w.text: I went to Grazie for Valentine's day, which can often be a difficult time to be a vegetarian (with all the prixe fixe menus full of the romantically dead lobsters and cows).  My boyfriend had reservations for us at a wonderful vegetarian friendly place only to find out that they would not be offering a vegetarian option for Valentine's day.  (Nothing says "I love you" like "you can't eat here").  This left him scrambling to find another place to eat, and he stumbled upon the vegetarian friendly Grazie.  As we approached the restaurant, you could hear how full of life and energy it was, even for such a typically quiet, romantic night.  I'm not one for an overly stuffy restaurant, so I love it.  There was a beautifully lit patio that stretches around the building completed with a large fireplace on the side.  The wine list was presented first, which was actually something of a disappointment from someplace calling themselves a wine bar.  I'll drink just about anything, and I liked the way it was arranged, but they were definitely lacking in a few more options.  However, we did enjoy a nice glass of Spanish chardonnay that went well with our food for the evening.  To begin, we chose the cheese platter, which was worth every penny of the $15 price.  Unaware of what exactly to expect (the menu did not list the cheeses), we were pleasantly surprised to find the 5 or 6 different kinds of cheeses presented in generous portions.  This certainly was not the skimpy cheese plates I'm used to.  However, because there was SO much cheese, we felt that it was almost overkill without some tomatoes or bread to cut the the richness.  (I'll never complain about too much cheese though).  For our meal, we split the Marcello pizza, which was delicately seasoned with garlic and topped with Roma tomatoes.  The crust was thin and crispy and held up well to the rich sauce.  Overall, Grazie is a place that I would recommend and visit again for some indulgent food and a beautiful ambiance.

Mny9DiYQGGKzgYlRHa9pEg.text: Horrible service, good food.    Wife and I ordered a pizza and salad to share; plus I ordered a glass of house WHITE wine.  Server brought water, and we sat - unattended - for 30 minutes. Finally the food came, and server realized we had no side plates or silverware; water was empty; and no wine.  She brought items one-by-one, then explained she needed to wait for the wine until the "bartender" returns???  She brought house RED.  Finally the correct wine came, and it was terrible ( and dark yellow).  Ate, asked for check, and again a lengthy wait.  Entered the restaurant looking for our check, complimented the chef, but no check - again, wait for "bartender."  Finally got check, offered my credit card, and waited again - for "bartender" to run card.  "Bartender" apologized for the wait on the check, and I told of the experience.  "Bartender " asked if I had been in the restaurant before, I said "No, and probably won't return.". "Bartender" said, "If I had that experience, I wouldn't return either."  Good luck.

7NGVO3hchs8PPUHZbNRPug.text: The food was excellent, the wine selection was excellent, & the service was EXCELLENT!    I had a scavenger hunt going for my boyfriend the night I went, because he LOVES their dessert, and the entire staff was VERY willing to help me out.  The server brought the present/next clue out with the dessert.  Everyone from the guy who answered the phone to take the reservation to the hostess to the server were very friendly and offered excellent customer service.    The food was delicious - we had a cheese & meat appetizer, with a sausage, mushroom, & mozzarella pizza, followed by the Dolce for dessert.  Everything was fantastic, but that Dolce was TO DIE FOR.  YUM!    Highly recommend this place. : )

hqQltgRAZrfSr5GbhN9Zcg.text: BEST PIZZA IN PHX!   If you are craving great Pizza at a nice little place in Phx, Garzi is the place for you.  My guy and I are food fanatics and he loves Italian so he was recommended by an Italian colleague to try this place. Pizza was unmistakeable great and probably better than Pizzeria Delfina in San Francisco which was THE place for us till now. Though it is in Phx, the prices are not the average phx prices but the taste totally validates charging that much.   Could have given 5 stars but our server was a little uptight.

h4wOLuyBpDA7Gz6OMVL3mQ.text: Haven't been in a few months, but I have been meaning to post my review. My office is down the road and we used to visit Grazie on a regular basis. Also a great place to take a date. Pizza is always excellent. Love the taste and texture. I read a review before I started this post. Ummm "Christine" why would you wanna ruin excellent pizza with ranch? Lol. Btw don't go to Grimaldies down the road cause they don't have ranch either. Maybe Pizza Hut? So funny. I like ranch too but def not needed for Grazie or Grimaldies pizza pies!! Maybe just bring a packet in your purse... Oops I kinda got off topic. To sum it up: great food, wine selection, and last time I went there was an intoxicating server. She had a great accent...

zYQc2DWsRqe6eJBhRGJa-Q.text: First, I would like to say that my husband and I have been here numerous times for dates, group parties, etc. Usually, both the food and service are wonderful, so I am hoping last night was an anomaly.   My husband and children took me to Grazie's last night for my birthday. When we first arrived, it was fairly empty, but it did seem understaffed. When our waitress came to take our drink order, she seemed a bit distracted. I overheard several tables next to us talking across to each other about how she had already messed up their drink orders or not brought them things they had ordered.   It took the waitress quite awhile to get back to us, but when she did my husband and I ordered salads, a Toscana pizza to share and a cheese pizza for our children to share. By this time the clientele had picked up quite a bit, and the waitress seemed harried. It took a long time to get our salads. When they came, my lettuce was limp, as though it had been sitting in dressing for a while, and the tomatoes were mealy and unappetizing. Next, when the pizza came out, portions of our children's pizza was black and burnt. However, we had waited too long at this point I did not want to send it back and so cut around the burnt parts for our children to eat.  As this was a birthday dinner, I wanted dessert, so when the waitress came I ordered ice cream for the kids and and a desert for my husband and I to split. We waited 25 minutes. My children's ice cream came but My husband and I still had no dessert, so I went to find the waitress. I asked her if it was on the way and found out it hadn't even been cooked yet, so I asked her to cancel the order and bring us the check. When she came with the check, she was very rude, at which point I stated it would have been helpful to be advised how long we would be waiting so we could decide if we even wanted dessert in the first place, since we were on our way to the Botanical Garden light display. Then the waitress rudely asserted "you have obviously never worked in the food service industry" and began to lecture me. Then she said "You can just not tip me then!" And stomped off angrily. When she came back with the check, she proceeded to lecture condescendingly about empathy, at which point I was really angry and just wanted to leave and not spoil the plans my husband had made.  As I stated before, usually the food is very good here, and I can forgive a messed-up meal given that they seemed short-staffed. However, if this is the tenor of service we can expect from the wait staff, I am loathe to return.

SMCM1DFl6UpqyGfR2JxYig.text: The food and sangria were amazing. However, our server reeked liked booze and probably shouldn't have been at work that night.

tXntfeje2luzHTeevWTk3g.text: Grazie was wonderful.  We went for the first time last month, to meet family friends that were in town.  The owner greeted us and let us taste some wines before we decided on a bottle.  Service was friendly, timely, and personal.  The pizzas were fantastic.  We also had bruschetta and salad, both of which were also delicious.  The nutella dessert was SO incredible!  We will definitely be back and can't believe we hadn't been there sooner.

RLGhF3rScJKhul1p6qQkwQ.text: I went to Grazie with my family, visiting from out of town. It was cold out that eve so I requested the front door be closed. The waitress told me, "We are supposed to keep it open." Not a very accommodating voice or comment. I looked around and the only reason I could see for this was that the woodfired oven is in the direct path of the air from the front door. GOD FORBID THE COOK GET HOT while he is making our pizza. We, and the other patrons ate pizza with our COATS ON. Really? The pizza isn't as good as it used to be. And the service BLOWS.

451mlC0AB8wYGJCaqeSHlw.text: I love the feel of this place as soon as you walk in. I have always found the staff to be very friendly and the food and wine are great.  I have been to Italy at least 7 times and the pizza here is as authentic as it gets! I would recommend......hang on......are you ready for this? The Vegetarian Pizza with Sausage added. I know, I know.....there is a reason for this. The veggies on this pizza are carmelized. Carmelized veggies and sausage are sent from heaven.  It is a great place for a casual date night.

wWUg3pWa-u_p8X8aaBt-qw.text: How did I not know about this place before? Their pasta is so delicious. The portion is large and the price is reasonable. We got some leftovers for the next day lunch.  They have variety selection of wine that suite everyone preference in my party. I enjoy my rose while other enjoy their red wines.  The food came out fast and our server is really nice. The dessert Dolce Della Casa took some times since it is a banana Nutella calzone. The chocolate chip ice cream really goes well with this warm delicious dessert.  Love this cozy place and the smell of baked dough bread!

gr8Q_h7pJuIpRnz1IBu5fg.text: Seriously don't go here. The owner is RUDE AF. I wouldn't support him again, I watched him throw out a BABY for being "too loud" when I wasn't bothered a bit and NO ONE complained. I wouldn't claim to be kid friendly.  Used to like this place before I moved, but there is plenty of good Italian food around when I come in town to visit family.

2TF-cTKF2l9RMtb4EyDfMg.text: Pros: Great food  Great wine Beautiful Patio Good prices Laid back service  Cons: Service may be  too laid back for some people or high maintenance people  I had pasta with red sauce and pancetta and it was bomb!  We got the house bottle as well.  My buddy had bolognese and my wife and buddies wife shared a gluten free pizza with mushrooms and sausage.  All the food was tasty.   Come check me out!

dM3VkeCpgK7awBM1noUOew.text: Super disappointed I wish we had never visited this restaurant! The owner of GRAZIE is so rude! I will not support him anymore! My children and I were asked to leave his restaurant because he claimed my kids were being too loud! I have a 1 year old and a 2 year old and we were by far not the loudest group there! The restaurant was full of people. I felt discriminated against and humiliated by this man.   TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!!!!

8Fxmj-pWQDMuY7QtA0xD-w.text: Writing this review while still in the restaurant. We had a group birthday dinner here tonight (Saturday). Since it's summer it's not nearly as busy. Our server was kind of new, but really made a good effort. Service was slow, but ok from that standpoint. But, they did forget my meal, and had to cook it after serving everyone else. Keep in mind a waitress verified our order prior to it going in. The meal came out and was inedible. Chicken Parmigiana was the worst, and others that had this meal had the same issue. Dry, leathery chicken. Our white pizza was not really any better. You could not bite through the crust or the meat. This is a shame since this little place has a nice atmosphere... I left feeling very nauseous. After our drive home, I'm even worse.  I would NOT recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bar area

OcQml6TUKuTrtLL8reWs1A.text: Always the best , if you have ever tried to eat a crab cake , you have no idea how they should be " board says best crab cake on the planet" it's the truth swear on my heart !!! The best . Our order is always the same . Crab cake , ceased salad , toscana pizza !!! If you find a fault in this recommended order you just need to stay home

cWTY9xYgxaol1ok8i52hDQ.text: Came here on the recommendation of a friend. Very disappointed. Service was near non-existent. Food was left to be desired. I had the magherita pizza. It took over 30 min to cook. Does not make sense with a wood fire oven that should crank out pizzas very efficiently. Way too heavy on the cheese and sauce. No basil on top. The shining element was the dough; however, it was uneven in flavor and thick/thinness. One slice was good, the other slice bland. I feel the best thing this place has going for it is the decor. I love the rustic feel and vibe of an old Italian restaurant. If only they could fix the food and service you would have a dynamic combo.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Magherita Pizza

ICohwnvwzujb0B-xrl2qGQ.text: If I could give zero stars I would.. this place was the worst place I have ever been.. we had awful service all night.. our server was awful we waited for over an hour for our food.. she brought the wrong wine first.. she never gave us a taste just dropped the bottle off and said here you go.  And then after an hour wait for our food, I asked to speak with a manager more than once. This is where it actually gets worse. The manager who was in a beanie said why are you acting like a victim.. I wanted good service and good food and i got subpar on both.. they even auto gratuity my partt which speaks alot for why our service sucked.  DONT EVER COME HERE..THIS WAS THE WORST

MJgslDCSFauC8FL1N_OdmA.text: If I could give this place no stars I would. The food was mediocre at best and the service was one of if not the worst I've ever had. Ownership obviously let this place go and ran it to the ground. I will never go back. It's ashame because it once was good.

k8wnZihGUBBpML4c1mTS2A.text: I ate here the other night and the food was good but the service was HORRIBLE. I requested to speak with the manager and when the OWNER finally came over she told me I was being dramatic and was "acting like a victim". They forget a member of my group's food and could care less. I was so disappointed because I've eaten here before and the food was delicious but the service has never been up to par. I really hope the owners take this into consideration for future diners but I will never be back again.

FDx7k-5-IUsrNsNp0dvkRg.text: I've walked by this place so many times, now I regret it. What a wonderful place. Great staff, great people and great, great food.  Firstly we had a sexy waitress, who was up to her elbows in orders, and she couldn't apologize enough for her delays. It didn't matter, just watching her was fun enough.   They had great specials, like pear and cheese pasta, which was to die for and mussels which also were very good. Even for those who order shellfish in the desert.   Once the crowds thinned out, the service became so much better. But, it really didn't matter as this is a people watching restaurant. The food is the real deal, they have a wood burning pizza oven, but the pasta is AMAZING! Sadly I'm leaving the area soon, so I'll quickly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wonderful place
Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gi1I8dWCbxpHb6qINEM7TQ.text: Great carbonara and white pizza. Food takes time so either don't be in a rush or come early.

GUeE1hYoa6mZu1y9N7hJNg.text: I was there for a friend's birthday and what a rotten experience. The food took forever and one of the entrees was forgotten. The service was terrible and the management was even worse. And let's use the term management lightly, as this person was incredible unprofessional and rude. The server brought the wrong items, too. Also, I was under the impression adding gratuity is now longer legal in AZ. I will not be back EVER.

aeuAsfeQbFzHuXKLiC8pgw.text: Pizza was so yummy! Got the Napoli. Can't wait to come back and sample more . The flavor of the dough is fantismo and you'll never catch me eating za with out ranch but this place is the exception.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0xxQ2eGwYRJ_Zpb3iab-kg.text: We stumbled into this place by accident.  It turned out to be a very good experience.  We ordered 2 pizzas.  One plain and one Napoli (spicy).  Both thin crust, well done brick oven pizzas.  The sauce, the cheese and the dough were all very good. I personally liked the Napoli a little better, but both were great.     The dessert was over the top absolutely amazing.  We got their dessert calzone - Dolce Della Casa. OMG.  I wanted to get naked and rub this thing all over myself.  However, my wife and daughter wouldn't approve. I digress, the DDC comes to you in a huge calzone form and it's filled with Nutella, bananas and topped with rich vanilla ice cream.   It was amazing!  Other than a few dirty dishes/utensils, this place was great.  Check it out. LEAVE ROOM FOR DDC.   You've been warned.....

H95CnoxuQlI2fsP_mSP3yQ.text: Had the lasagna and it was reminiscent of hamburger helper (which I have enjoyed since a kid). Overall it wasn't bad, just not what I expected from an authentic Italian restaurant

aNKy4bAjCiCuAWpId3f8gQ.text: Good food. Poor service. Hostess was clueless. Forgot several things we ordered. Acted put out at normal requests. Other Italian dishes places around you can hit up.

XviWkv9oRX8lMzx9S9aQhQ.text: Went here on a double date with our friends and it was delicious!  We shared the special which was a 5 cheese pasta and a pizza that was to die for!  It's a small place that gives off a True Italian vibe, so you'd want to make a reservation if you're going on a Friday or Saturday like we did.  It can also get a little loud because of the close quarters so just be prepared.  Service was good and staff was friendly.

eI6ht_p-mC7aYhLyXgAAuw.text: I'm not sure what even happened. Twilight Zone experience. So sad because we walked in and the place is really an old school cute little Italian place and smelled so good. They sat us at a table and brought us water and our glasses of wine (which took quite a bit of time) and then we sat ............. finally the one and only server came and we asked for help with our wobbly table . She said let me move you to a better table which was back in the corner by the service area. The problem now was we suddenly seemed to be forgotten about. Service was so slow, we finally asked for our check and left.  This could be a great restaurant. We would love to be able to go back and try the food if they can fix the service issue. The $2.00 tip we left was too much for the 2 glasses of wine we got. Too much drama here!

nkh6t8Z1pVAFLThTYyYBmg.text: We had dinner here on vacation and it was a highlight of our trip.  I never thought ceasar salad was special until I had theirs.  Im not sure what makes it magical but it was AMAZING.  All the food was great and clearly made from scratch.  The server had great wine recommendations and really made us feel at home like we were in a little Italian neighborhood restaurant.  A few regulars came and went while we were there and they had such a heartwarming rapor with the staff which all just added to the warm ambience.

roxZgkhs850RKrY1lOW2Bw.text: We went on Friday night about 8:30 and found the place about 10% full... A far cry from my last few visits when we had to wait for a table. It was cold out, so we decided to sit by the fire on the patio. Looked around and none of the candles were lit on the tables... We lit our own. There was already a menu on the table when we sat down, not for us, it just happened to be at the table closest to the fire when we seated ourselves. Eventually our server made her way over to us, with no menus (or waters) and gleefully exclaimed "oh, there's already a menu here... It's a lunch menu, but it's basically all the same stuff." Are my friend and I to share the same menu and choose items hoping they're "basically the same" as what's on the menu?? Seriously? Upon request, she brings us dinner menus and we order a coke and a diet coke. A good while later (remember, the place is essentially empty) she returns with our drinks... A diet coke and an ice water. My friend reminds her that she actually ordered a coke, not water. "Ooohhhh that's right" and she sets off to get the coke. She returns awhile later to take our order... We order the Bresaola salad and the Capricciosa pizza (first, we ask what kind of olives are on the pizza, she says black. So we ask to have no olives, add tomatoes instead). We also remind her of the coke which has yet to arrive.  About 10 minutes goes by and she comes out with our pizza. Our pizza? She sets it on the table and notices the look of confusion on our faces and asks "did you order something else?" I said "Wow. Yes, the Bresaola" she says "that's right... It's on me, I'll be back with that" I said "okay, I'll take another diet coke and we also need silverware, napkins, plates and we are still waiting on that coke!" So as we sit watching our pizza get cold right before our eyes... We notice it's covered in olives. Of coarse it is. But we are okay with it because they are not black olives, like she said, they are kalamata. Once we get everything we need (including the elusive coke, but not my diet refill) and take a bite of our luke warm pizza... Despite not being hot from the oven or what we ordered, it was still pretty tasty. Our appetizer arrives after our entree and it too is d'lish. I remind her about my refill.. "Oh that's right" she says. Again, WOW.  We decide on dessert... Tiramisu and a calzone filled with Nutella and bananas topped with vanilla ice cream and 2 espressos. The salad dishes remain on our table as she arrives with our desserts... But there's nowhere to set them down so we start sliding all our dirty dinner dishes around to make room for the new arrivals. Then she leaves, I'm assuming to get our espressos... Now why would I think that? We did only tell her once that we would like them. Indeed, I see her inside not making our coffees and so I get up, walk in and say "espressos?" And she again says "oh yeah!" (Wow) and brings them out and states that these too are on her. I ask for sugar for our coffees (really?) and the bill... It arrives and the salad and espressos were not on the bill but I do see what went wrong with our no olives request for the pizza, it says right below it "86 the mushrooms". Bummer. We love mushrooms.  I know this review is long and detailed, but to say we had AMAZINGLY BAD service is the understatement of the year. I'll be spending my money at Cibo and Pizzeria Bianco instead, where the food AND the service is always great!

jOZeDcMncCRs1rs-HSEoMA.text: Vegetarian pizza was amazing. The boyfriend seemed to like his pepperoni pizza. Didnt try any wine. Our server was pleasant, ambience was enjoyable. We were being tourists for the weekend and dont plan to head back to Scottsdale anytime soon, but this place is worthy of a nice Yelp review :)

2hzIuJm7l4VXsJvHxYvPAQ.text: Most authentic Italian pizza experience in Phoenix! Not to mention a killer Italian wine list with lots of guidance from the staff and owner. Our favorites on the menu are the Ceasar salad, Toscana pizza, Dame Edna pizza, and the espresso.

7IL1BprpO-zoJ8aCLMzvpg.text: I agree with the previous reviews and wish I listened.  We had a horrible experience tonight.  I was with my friend and her mom and the service was horrible.  Many mistakes made and the owner refused to take responsibility and make good.  Instead the manager or owner treated us horrible, raised his voice, and was beyond disrespectful.  Avoid at all costs....I mean...still in shock!

atrT59LcQKzyHJiKaml0tw.text: One of my favorite places in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area. I live in CA but I visit Scottsdale often and I love this restaurant/bar. The food is great and the pizza is so good! The service is great and the staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. The restaurant has a wonderful, chill, candle lit atmosphere perfect for a date night or just going out with some friends. The price of the food and drinks is just right too. If you're wondering what to do one night, go here! You will love it.

3FZj-iCjXEMHIjsN19WfZQ.text: Incredible pizza!!!! Go to this place. I got the Roma pizza and it took me straight to the ocean. It has a good wine selection, great appetizers, and the crust on the pizza is thin, crispy, and perfect.

Sv6Mjm5Piv4n_VsYSJ7OBg.text: It's my favorite place when I'm in the Scottsdale area.  Love the caesar salad and the vegetariana pizza with the addition of smoked mozzarella.  Don't forget to order the tiramisu, it's ahhhhmazing!

9fqRjzZa2EoURmOwDZHBAw.text: Not only is the food delicious but the service was amazing! We ordered the meat and cheese platter with a caprese salad. It was the perfect combination for a hot night. We took our time, enjoyed the food and we never felt rushed. Now it's your turn!

VwXwBZ_2Z1qcMR6kqKgQ-w.text: I learned about Grazie through a Groupon, but I don't think that I will be a repeat customer...  The interior is very small and has a cozy atmosphere, but for some reason the staff left the door propped open all night (and it was one of those rare freezing nights in Phoenix) which made it super cold - all the diners had their heavy outdoor coats still on.  Maybe that's a trick to get you to drink more and warm up?  The vegetarian pizza was very rich and flavorful, although the caramel onions were almost TOO sweet.  The 12 inch is a little small to split between two people, we should have ordered an appetizer to fill us both up.

ybZnVjU4DN2ElSfo1nRpQw.text: Oh my gosh...this place is the bomb!  Love the homemade mozzarella.  It is soooo good!  The place is gorgeous, I was able to have nice happy hour prices and hang and do work!  Free wifi!

Rr3lS9egq_WsaOBsO_R6Kg.text: After passing by Grazie countless times and being told by multiple people that it had great food, we finally tried it. What a disappointment.   I ordered their Margherita pizza with BLACK olives. I stressed BLACK three times to the server. What did I get ... Kalamata olives, which I despise. I sent it back for a plain Margherita. All three of the pizzas, my husband's, the one I sent back and the second one they brought me all had at least one-third of the crust burnt. And I mean burnt black. But that wasn't the worst of the taste issues. The cheese on the pizzas was so horribly salty! If we weren't so tired and hungry, we would have sent them back and left. After hearing such great things about this place, I was shocked at the poor quality of the food.

R_22uAhes6GkaMUHv7XCSw.text: It's actually 2 and a half star. food was pretty good. Customer service was horrible. My girlfriend had to ask who our server is. This spot wasn't so welcoming from the time we walked in. I had the crostini cardinale which was good eatings and girlfriend had the giardinia pizza. Overall it was alright.

4PFGy1IfBlFrIbSxYjFhBQ.text: Just gone done with a birthday dinner here for my cousin. I will say what we ordered (Margherita pizza) was very good, but others at our table were disappointed with what they ordered. The mozzarella was some of the best I've ever had.  My issue is with the service. Dinner was at 7. Our waitress, Victoria, failed to clear plates from the table, had to make it a point that they don't offer free birthday desserts because "they get 2 to 4 birthdays a night." That's fine, but I'm sure every birthday table is dropping $200 or more on wine & food and you can't give out a small free birthday dessert?  The worst part of the night was waiting FORTY-FIVE minutes for her to tally 5 separate checks for 14 people. What should have been an enjoyable 1.5 half hour dinner turned into a 2.5 hour nightmare with some of the worst service I've ever received. Even the owner was sitting at the bar with a glass of wine on his laptop and ignoring the 3 birthday tables he had.  In fact, getting the check took so long that by the time we left we were hungry again, so we stopped off at Burrito Express & got great service!

1_jitbSZ5ds4Fz9NJuJiyg.text: We had a delightful al fresco lunch at Grazie this past week. As frequent travelers to Italy, my husband and I look for a thin crust pizza, crisp insalata and a cold Italian wine. We were not disappointed and we are particular. The house salad dressing is a gorgonzola vinaigrette, a perfect dressing for the salad greens. The pizza Margarita was especially to our liking, thin crust and not too cheesy, but not dry. The owners were attentive and we were not rushed. A perfect Italian lunch, in Scottsdale!

sxk_A_G1_lTbcTWv2wGdKg.text: While the pizza is still pretty good, the service has somehow gone downhill-which seems almost impossible considering it was already pretty terrible from the beginning. Came here recently with a large group- our server only took orders for 1/2 of the table- and it took over 30 minutes to get her to come back to take the rest. Literally 30 minutes of arm waving, which then turned into finger snapping (which I know is rude) and then eventually we went up to the bar to see if we could place an order there, which the rude owner said NO that we had to wait for our server(bullshit). We were about to call in and place a to go order at this point. Our entire table had their food and were pretty much done eating by the time we finally flagged her down. At that point, she told us it would still be a few minutes. Anyway, long rant/story short- our pizza arrived cold. I don't think it was necessarily our servers fault- the place is always super understaffed and accommodates too many large groups at once. They need to staff more people. Especially on a Friday night. During spring We will probably return- but only for date night.

WeMbOwZhLfJkL2SAHKBWCA.text: First time ordering, thought we'd try a new spot. Mistake! if you like thin over priced no crust pizza, eat here.2 pies should have had some weight but these "pizzas" we're like large burnt pita crisps with some sauce and cheese on them. I tried to talk to the owner/manager but he defended his well-done pizza. Told me I didn't know how to order pizza, I was surprised he defended the pizza it was so burnt. I will say this, he did refund me but I will also say that I drove down the block and got a large well-done deep golden brown pie and anti-pasta for less than his 2 burnt pita pizzas.

UhmcL50b9uI9U-Myfxfd8g.text: I've been a Grazie fan for a few years now and I definitely don't go there as much as I should!  I love the quaint, cozy atmosphere and enjoy eating inside or on the patio. Their Emiliana salad and Dolce Della Casa dessert (sweet calzone filled with nutella, bananas and ice cream) are amazing. As far as pizzas, I've never tasted one I didn't like here. On my most recent visit, I had the Toscana and it was great!  I've been here on dates, with girlfriends and large groups for birthdays and bachelorette dinners and would recommend Grazie to anyone!

RcJNy1pwtwMtndpgLWpiLQ.text: Awesome food, great atmosphere and great service. I think it's definitely some of the best pizza in Scottsdale.

B94Qv61bCM9Ru5_O9ChE5A.text: It's been years since I've been to Grazie, but I was pleasantly surprised that this place is still hopping!   The service can be slow at times, but it's a great spot for a leisurely date night or dinner with friends. I absolutely love the twinkle lights romantically lighting the courtyard and the cozy and quaint vibe inside. The brick oven keeps the restaurant warm and smelling delicious. The customers are typically vibrant which makes this a lively spot but in a way that allows you to carry on a conversation without your neighbors listening in. For the food, I enjoy one of the bruschettas or bread dishes to start and for pizza, I love the Toscana which is mushroom and sausage. The pizza is thin crust and delicious. This is by far one of my favorite pizza spots and date night destinations in Old Town.

OmTPUN4WyBvZ6vLNuYMw-Q.text: Great venue!  I travel on average every week so I visit nervous restaurants.  Grazie is a great wine & pizza venue that is reasonably priced for great salad & pizza!  Had the caprese salad, Toscano pizza, & the Grazie Chianti.  Great service & staff!

Ugzqb0-snGNaqO6g-ZUXWQ.text: Grazie has some really delicious pizza, and its Italian wine offerings are top notch for most price ranges.  They also have an incredible dessert called "Dolce Della Casa" which is a semi-salty calzone stuffed with banana and drizzled with a hazelnut chocolate sauce.  Their wine tastings are also really great: for $25 you can get a bunch of great appetizers.  We tasted 8 wines (I had never tasted any of these) during the last one, and I really liked 6 of them.

d4UsvXZCbuabs04Gf0S3qg.text: Best food, wine and service in town!

pPtZQupe_jCX4VuhmQfd4w.text: My girl and I (who each work at a fine dining restaurant) were not only impressed but truly blown away by almost every facet of this place.   The service: She was attentive, food came out fast, was friendly, and made us feel welcome. She also recommended a wine for us that is our new favorite white: Trebbiano.  The food: Absolutely delicious. We split an appetizer sampler and for the most part everything that was on the plate was outstanding. The prosciutto covered figs were great, as was the bruschetta. Then our pizzas came out and i must say it might be the best pizza i have had in the greater phoenix area. It was amazing. Desert was also good, but i don't really have much of a sweet tooth.  Overall: The atmosphere was nice, patio seating was beautiful, wine list was amazing, service GREAT, and the food was phenomenal.  Thank you Grazie for a great evening.

6jI9jjo_iKuM79uIjS2nlA.text: Average at best.  However, I AM A FOOD SNOB.  I love the atmosphere, casualness and drinks.  I have been wanting to go here for a while and finally went tonight.  the website brags about "meticulously chosen imported italian ingredients".  which is great, but you need to put in an equal amount of care and preperation.  this is the area grazie seriously lacks.    Ordered the charceuterie plate and a marcello pizza.  here is the problem.  the cured meats were cut extremely lazily.  learning how to use a mechanical slicer requires little training and a small amount of effort.  uneven cuts, on a mechanic slicer!! really??  not executing something so simple shows little care and pride.  when it was brought to our table i asked the food runner what meats we had.  he responded by giving me an akward look and stacking the side plates he had just put in front of us, and walking away.  i understand the cheap labor that is available in arizona but, come on.  at the very least they should be able to tell customers what they are about to eat.  also dont be afraid to top cured meat with a drizzle of quality olive oil and some cracked pepper, maybe a squeeze of a lemon, for the price and claims, i would expect it.    the pizza was fine, until a sliced tomato fell off the pizza and exposed its nasty underside of an uncored tomato.  again showing the lack of care and preparation.  carelesness like this tells me the guy making the pizza saw a huge tomato core he put on a pizza and just turned it over to not expose the core.  and to top it all off with the garnish was a basil sprig, stem and all, in the dead center of the pizza and nowhere else.    overall its ok.  for being in old town it should be better.  there are a lot of quality places to go.  this is not one of them.   grazie, you have a good place, now get your kitchen up to par.

duBtt7V0n06U0WKSNxgp5g.text: This place is awesome.  Everything from the appetizers to the salad's and on to the pizza's!   Also an all Italian  wine list which anyone can find a wine they would love!!!     The place is truly one place you should visit!

iQL0NN9H-EnFrKOpXmR6Ew.text: Visited on October 28. There was a rehearsal dinner going on outside at the same time as our dinner.  Lots of confusion. Dawn our server was very attentive and apologetic. 4 stars for the food, but the chairs, tables and overall patio appearance was absolutely filthy.Chairs, tables and menus were full of soot! Patio concrete needed steam cleaning. Restaurant should be grateful there is a shortage of health inspectors.  We would like to return to this place but not until it is scrubbed cleaned.

a95iEHQ2eYwCqwfIPxKIVg.text: I have eaten at Grazies numerous times over the past couple of years and there pizza is fantastic! However, last night as my wife, son and mother-in-law made our way back once again we were disgusted as a baby German cockroach started crawling across our table from where our appetizer sat.  I was so disgusted, but out of respect for other patrons I stopped the waitress in the back and showed her the roach that I had smashed with my napkin.  Her reply was simply, "oh, sorry about that".  I was taken off guard at her carelessness and inattention to the situation.  I decided to walk around for a bit with my son and I started to notice the restaurant becoming less maintained. For example, the men's bathroom was destroyed, many of the track lighting was out throughout the restaurant, only half of the candles were lit on the table and dust covered almost every wine bottle at the entrance. I normally would have never paid attention, but the cockroach made me look at everything. Toward the end of the evening I was expecting to be compensated for the meal, but they only took off the appetizer and my beer. I was once again dumbfounded at the disregard for the situation. As I began to sign the check, we see another cockroach crawling down the wall next to us.  This time we all got up from the table and told another waitress who once again was numb to the situation. With that said, I can honestly say I would never eat there again and will take my business elsewhere.

p7Bzqb_Le9j0sTr2jegQxw.text: The food was good, but not for the price.  We paid $14 for a Caesar salad.  The pizza was good, but the service was slow. We went early on a Friday night and the wait staff was just standing around rather than waiting on us. I would not go back despite the pizza being good.

T6c6Ijhm-yvi5Q2F0YKJuQ.text: Came here on a Thursday night and it was quite busy!  Maybe all the snow birds are still in town.  I made rezs and we arrived early,yet they had no plan as to where we sit. We ended up sitting on the Patio. Which would be nice in the summer or spring but , a bit chilly for Jan.    They had 2 heaters outside.  However, we were just a little to far away to feel them.     We ordered a pitcher of the red Sangria wine, which they said they were out, but alass when they saw how dissappointed we were they made more!     We were very happy about that so that gives them extra points.        However, the Sangria was loaded with ice and there was ice in the wine glasses as well which made us even more cold.  Skip the ice when it is in the 40's outside.    We had the large Capresse salad which was excellant...The basil and cheese were huge and very tasty. Pizza was absolutly divine! Great crust ,wonderful mushrooms , and excellant Italian Sausage.                                                                                      Bathrooms were clean and parking can be a bit of a challenge.   Lacks a bit of atmosphere. The busboys were very attentive i give them extra points as well they were really working hard.

MEmBe1Uvwb856kyWXSKliQ.text: We had a party of 12 here for dinner this past Saturday night. Food and service were great. I think apart from Bianco's they are the best pizza in town! There is a very good Italian focused wine list, and a great fun atmosphere. This is a great place for a casual evening or group event.

U9kEOYaxtWj7bFh0Bj00NQ.text: This is a very popular place, albeit somewhat small, so I recommend either going early or preparing to wait a while for a table. The atmosphere and decor is rustic and interesting. That being said, let me comment about the food.      In a word: wonderful. I frequently begin with the Formaggi Misti, and assortment of cheeses served with grissini and kalamata olives. This is a teriffic appetizer to share!       This is usually followed with the Caprese salad - very simple, but the combination of tomatoes, fresh basil, buffalo mozarella, and extra virgin olive oil does it for me every time.       And if I hadn't had enough sodium, I order the Roma pizza - and extra-thin pizza with more kalamata olives, capers, and anchovies! My mouth waters just writing these lines about it...      Much has been written about the extensive wine list, but let me just say this...you can spend as much or as little; you can find something to satisfy any taste.       I have never experienced a bad meal or poor service at Grazie - in fact, more often that not the evening at Grazie is stellar.       Bottom line: if you're looking for an informal dinner with excellent wine choices, you won't do better in Greater Phoenix.

n-gF1qmBlqQ93cOw0MeaJQ.text: Subject: Hey... To: Grazie Cc: yelp.com So, how are you? I just wanted to let you know that last night was fun....No, really we had a good time and all. You really shouldn't beat yourself up over last night, you were busy, there was lots goin' on ;) Again, it's no big deal. Everyone burns a pizza...It happens. And, yeah I know, bagged lettuce for a salad is easier then freshly chopped. Hey, don't we all cut corners sometimes to save a bit of time? Go easy on yourself....I know that you wanted to have better service, but it just didn't happen. Your head wasn't in the game...Well, anyway, I may as well get to the point: This is awkward...I just feel like we need to go our separate ways....Stop, I know what you're gonna say, it's just better this way! There'll be plenty of others that will come along and you'll have long forgotten me...These things happen! I'll get by and try other pizzas and see what happens...We can always still be friends and happy for each other :) Anyway, I won't be seeing you around anymore, so just take care and have a great life.... :(

Lzxx36EFGZBvSevtZDIhCw.text: Aside from being a $ date spot (that's "money" like how Trent in Swingers would say it, not like "expensive"), they have an excellent wine selection and great service. It's picked up steam the past couple years and has made a name as a trendy spot to drink wine and eat gourmet pizza, so be ready to squeeze into a table if you come in a large group.   IMHO, it's worth it (don't hate on the acronyms, folks). The food is legit and the wine is good. Considering all the attention it seems like this place gets, it hasn't gotten a big head about it. The prices are more than fair and the ambiance is invariably on point. It makes for a great double date or group outing spot as a precursor to a night out in Old Town.

yOqyvi4EmXp1459iW0N-nQ.text: Stick to the pizza.  The salads tend to be under-dressed and boring (some quality extra virgin olive oil on the pre-packaged mixed greens would jazz things up).   Stay away from the beef skewers, they are over-priced and over-cooked to the point of being charred to a crisp.  My brother and I ended up getting what looked like skewered charcoal for our meal.

b0A_op7mEV-t46dk8psMyw.text: so good, love coming here!  so quaint and great food.  we always save room for dessert-nutella and banana's in a calzone crust with vanilla ice cream :) yum!!!  The service was good, we could tell it was slammed for just 2 servers to manage on a thursday, but good thing we were in the mood for a leisurely dinner ;) can't wait to come back!

X_ohYUG9Ael2lAQJL7MX2Q.text: I am in love with Grazie. My sister and I discovered this place after we returned from our trip to Italy. We were ecstatic to find authentic wood fired Italian pizza. I would highly recommend this place if you crave fresh pizza with a fantastic wine selection.

x_K19tFthkY81KZQx3N9BA.text: Although we were a large party, that is no excuse to stick us in a dark corner.  Yes, the pizza was very good.  But dessert was not up to snuff.  The panna Cotta was so buried in coca powder that you could not find the True dessert.  We scraped off some and yes they were better.  But when you walk away from a $410 dollar dinner for 9 you would expect to be sooo fat and sassy.

V9rCSO8lPeC4pgaeKh47bQ.text: This quaint little place is a gem in Old Town Scottsdale.  The oven brick pizzas are amazing and the wine selection is great.

qFkbyOY4MlEx9fqoxCIsVg.text: Great place, always stop in when I am in town.  They have a wood oven and cook most everything in it.   I love the Italian beef on skewers with vegetables that they do in the oven.  Pizza,  and deserts are great.  Salads are very good and a meal in themselves.  One desert, and I have never had it, is huge and obscene, but looks great (it is also done in the wood oven).  Excellent Italian wine list.  I don't know the deal with the prior owners but the Italian guy I meet who I believe owns the place now is very nice.  Big soccer fan.  Waite staff is very friendly.

eS-MAx6WWYLvsjoE1yEBjA.text: Ok let me start by saying that I've always loved Grazie and think the pizza is delicious and authentic to pizzas you can find in Naples, but over the years this place has just flat out gone down hill. Went there on a Saturday night and the place was fairly empty, which is odd since it's in old town Scottsdale. The pizza we ordered (just a basic margarita) took 45 minutes to arrive and to top it off, it was undercooked. This is when things got interesting. We told the waitress that the pizza was bad and she informed us that the pizza cook had gotten so drunk that they had to send him home so out pizza had been cooked by the salad prepper. She then offered to take half off the pizza. We were upset, but by this point were also kind of amused by it all and honestly appreciated the girls honesty. As we were leaving we noticed the owner sitting at the bar watching football. He didn't even acknowledge us. You would think in a restaurant that is clearly struggling (empty on a otherwise busy Saturday night) that the owner would have at least tried to do some damage control and talk to us. But no. He clearly doesn't care if his own restaurant succeeds or fails. So why should we? So with that we won't be back again. Which is sad cause it's been a fave of mine for past 5 years.

w_R79Eo4OePAmstPSOlibw.text: This place is really good, but I cannot give 5 stars for 2 reasons.   1. We ordered about 5 pizzas and a couple of them came out with fairly burnt crust. I'm not a fan of the burnt taste on crust. Just about everyone at the table ignored the crust... unusual for our group. This does not detract from the pizza itself, which was very good.  2. They don't know how to pour beer. The only have 3 (I suppose it is a wine bar after all), but at least know how to poor it if you're going to serve it. We ordered at least 5 pints and each of them came with half head. Kind of annoying. Luckily the glass was chilled, so it was still cold once it settled.  The pizza is so good, the alla mamma is our favorite. The sangria was delicious, we downed a whole pitcher. I would definitely come back to this place in a second. The owners (I believe thats what they were) were very kind and welcoming. They took care of us very well and we were happy with our visit.

e_KCoA3PRNJbEWxneJYQ8w.text: Amazing pizza in a great atmosphere. Awesome selection of wines as well. It is one of the best reasons to come to Old-town Scottsdale.

rtg-tTP5fs3diG3hjgWdMg.text: I drove from L.A. to Phoenix for an overnight trip last month.  It was a brutal couple of days.  When I arrived in Phoenix with a couple hours to kill, I decided to spend them with my dog, a book, and some wine, to unwind from the long drive.  I walked into Grazie late on a Monday afternoon and stayed for about two hours.  The place was more or less empty, and I got a nice table on the patio all to myself.  It was a very hot day, and the patio wasn't quite comfortable, but it was as well covered and cool as it could be.  I drank two glasses of white wine from the extensive menu.  Both were quite good, and suited to the weather.  It was a mostly pleasant afternoon, but a couple things turned me off to Grazie.  One, while I was clearly not allowed inside with my dog (never expected, of course), the owner or someone on staff had two dogs inside the restaurant, roaming around.  At one point, the dogs came out, checked out my dog, and then one of them peed on the concrete wall right next my table, a foot away from where I was sitting.  Come on...I love dogs, but that's just gross.  Two, my second glass of wine came with a small surprise - I took one sip and pulled a dead bug from my tongue.  I pointed this out to my waiter, who did, to be fair, offer to replace the glass.  I thought it would be a shame to throw out the wine and I didn't mind drinking it, but I also kind of figured I might get that glass free, or get another glass thrown in.  I guess when I said I didn't want the wine to go to waste, the waiter decided that was that.  That said, the waiter was perfectly nice, and I had a good time drinking at Grazie.  I left with a light buzz, which was great for that time of day.  If I lived in town the dogs and the bug might still deter me from coming back, but I can't say I didn't enjoy my visit.

qBqw73v7olC_j-aM2R0mxQ.text: Great food and service. We had meat/cheese sampler, small Caesar, and the tascona pizza. Oh don't forget desert it was great too! If we lived here we would be regulars for sure.

ReMus-jxuR7gTyUaZZz29w.text: I should have known when the restaurant was nearly empty on a Saturday night that Grazie was no longer the restaurant I once loved. We ordered a simple Margarita Pizza and it was soggy and undercooked when it arrived. We asked our stressed out server if they could put it back in the oven and she nearly burst into tears. She said that we were one of several patrons that had the same complaint and the owner was furious. The server was very sweet and apologetic when she brought the same pizza back to us still soggy and inedible. This was our last visit to a once awesome restaurant.

4ijYB5669ffoVDnZONXD9g.text: 1st time eating here and it was great!!! The service was just as good as the food. Prior to groupon (thanks) I didn't even know they existed. Will definitely revisit and highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YD2H_yrNCZwfu2u9vQXKig.text: I have been to Grazie twice now! Both times a groupon was used - the groupon entailed a 12inch pizza of choice and then a pitcher or white or red sangria. When you arrive at Grazie you notice it's sweet and quaint ambiance. It is a smaller place with a nice patio. All the servers and staff are really nice there. It is pretty laid back and casual.   The first time I came here I was with two friends. We opted for the red sangria, a salad to share, and the vegetarian pizza. Everything was really good and flavorful. The crust is amazing on the pizza!   I went with my parents last night and again we got the red sangria. The sangria is very good- not too sweet but not bitter. We got the Americana pizza (pepperoni ) and added sausage on it. We got the bread and oil. The bread was just room temp. bread and I wasn't totally impressed by it- it did it's job though. The pizza was OUTSTANDING! I am so glad we got the sausage as it brought an extra kick to the meal. I like Grazie a lot and can't wait to go back!

oSxETzxPMNpECYMgLT1v3A.text: Mad props to Grazie. My husband and I went for lunch. We had an expired Groupon, but the owner didn't mind the expiration date and still honored the deal.   We ordered two pizzas and a pitcher of sangria. The sangria is phenomenal--fruity and strong. The pizzas were crazy good. Nice heaps of ricotta, peppers, and sausage on one and tasty prosciutto and arugula on the other.  The service was great--as it should be because the place was dead. The decor is cute and I definitely want to return for dinner hours and enjoy the great looking patio. Also, they have Nutella in bulk in the prep area, so I want to get into whatever that's on.

hRCPR_C5_0SitHZfEzsATw.text: I had lunch here, a few years now since my last time. The whole experience was worse than disappointing.  First Impression: a stubborn, moldy smell in the dim and dank dining room.   I ordered a salad, and my friend ordered the Caprese.  The salad arrived in a flash - and no wonder: there was no care taken with it at all.  Bell peppers were clumsily chopped, and I pulled out so many yellowed, thick, and rotting leaves from the baby greens that I finally had to call the owner over and send it back.    I ordered a small Caprese in its place.  The mozzarella was dry and rubbery - not at all the tender, moist, fresh cheese you expect in a Caprese - especially at these prices.  The tomatoes were overripe and breaking down, and the basil consisted of a sprig of tough, oversized leaves. Bland olive oil drenched the whole plate, and there was no seasoning at all.  Nine dollars for a nearly inedible plate of food.     I ordered a beer on tap, which came with a large head of foam, sitting well below the rim of the mug. I chose not to complain, since I never finish a whole beer, anyway.   All the time I ate, the unpleasant odor of the room did not diminish in the least.  It was about as bad a dining experience as I can imagine.  Had the quality of the food been excellent, I'd still have to remark on the prices, which are on the steep side.  But given the poor quality, I felt majorly ripped off.      As we left, I learned that my friend had the same complaint about his Caprese. We both feel the place has really deteriorated in several years' time.  Maybe the pizza is the saving grace, but I'm not giving the benefit of the doubt to an owner who is so lacking in respect for both his establishment and his customers.  I'll never go back.

_kUtmAadBOGGDueWMiPFgw.text: Great space, our server was lovely, the other waitress who was working was very nice. It's a very clean, cozy spot for a restaurant with a beautiful brick oven. Unfortunately, my food was so bad that it seemed almost like a joke. Like somebody pouring salt in your coffee. Shockingly bad. I was pleased to see that there was a vegan option, (penne arrabiata), unfortunately, it was one of the worst meals I have ever had at a restaurant. How something can be that spicy, but completely lack flavor is beyond me. I don't understand how this person is employed quite frankly. I would be embarrassed to serve that in my home, much less at a restaurant claiming this to be my profession. It tasted like they spooned tomato paste out of a can, dumped in red pepper flakes, and called it sauce. The sauce was very thick and very red, and grainy. If you cook tomato paste long enough, it eventually loses that tinny flavor. They did not cook it long enough, and they forgot some key ingredients: water, SALT, sugar, herbs, spices, a little olive oil, garlic, maybe a little onion... I hope the chef was out sick and the bus boy had to fill in or something, because what I was served was unacceptable. I'm bummed because I really had high hopes for this place. They have a beautiful patio. I will say that my boyfriends food was very good. He ordered the carbonara. So, maybe they just need to put a little more thought into their arrabiata. Perhaps taste it before sending it out and ask themself if THEY would want to eat it. If the answer is yes, they need to get out of the restaurant business, because they don't know anything about food and don't care.

pZzFCecJU-kqXJ8CzfnuNw.text: It makes me really sad to write this review as I have always had a pretty good experience at Grazie until recently. We decided to head there for Valentine's Day dinner on Friday night as we have done this now every year for the past 4 years....We arrived at 8pm and noticed it wasn't busy at all. There were about 10 tables or so (maybe less) that had people sitting at them so we got seated right away outside. Our server Johnny, placed our menus at our table and off he went....about 10 minutes later he comes back to take our drink order. My boyfriend had the larger and I had a glass of wine. He delivered those and brought us water and walked away....about 10 minutes later he came back to take our order. I had the Cinque Formaggi as I always look forward to this pizza and my boyfriend had the Margherita. I noticed the prices had increased but I was ok with it because I know it was going to be good. Off went our server and then nothing......he didn't come back to check on us or see if we wanted maybe another glass of wine, beer or even more water! 30 minutes went by and nothing yet....45 minutes went by and still no food! I am at this point starving as it is now past 9 and still no food, no server coming to check on us. Meanwhile, the table next to us (family of 4) ordered, ate and paid their check all since we had ordered. I even noticed the table of 4 behind us said, "pizza was pretty good but the server has forgotten about us." I turned around and said at least you guys got your food! We are still waiting!! Our server came back and said my pizza was almost done...wait, what?!? Almost...this thing should have been done 40 minutes ago! We are going now on an hour ticket time and still the restaurant maybe had less than 20 people. My pizza comes out 5 minutes before my boyfriends so we ate at two different times and I had to ask for more water for my boyfriend as the waiter was walking off. Not once did he ask if he could get us anything, I guess I wasn't wanting to have another glass of wine with dinner because I now don't have anything but water. One thing I noticed is also how bad the pizza looked! For $17 I expect a pizza to have toppings on each piece! There were several slices that were not worth eating! At this point I'm so irritated at the horrible service and food I just wanted to leave. While our server Johnny was nice he didn't do a good job at waiting on tables, offering more drinks or even putting the orders in since it did take over an hour. I always look forward to going to Grazie's but after this experience I don't think we will be back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I would think for $17 toppings would cover 100% of the pizza. Very Disappointed!

-CXyakzuWhoaf-yJUJB-Ng.text: I am a local Old Town resident and stopped by for a pizza and glass of wine last night. The owner, Marcellio, introduced himself and explained his wine purchasing; good wines at a reasonable price....available for purchase by the bottle or case. The house Chianti was very good. Marcellio is from Italy and been here about 15 years. Also, Sandy, the chef helped me pick out a couple pizzas that were thin crust and cooked in a wood fired pizza oven. Really good pizza! The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and reminded me of dining in Rome a few years ago.

OGKRyDUY-mRVzvIJ9-hdUg.text: Had a fantastic pizza and Caesar salad with fresh garlic, relaxed open air atmosphere with a great vibe and music. Terrific wine list - lots of Italian, with many by the glass, always nice to have a wide selection. We had great service with a smiling server, lots of others seemed to be enjoying themselves too.

YGTn-w1RDljrjCXOU-j02g.text: tired pizza and tired owner. do yourself a favor and walk down the street and get a pizza at Craft 64. by far better..

i36JSaRYMB0_36zoMhZhvA.text: This is my favorite place to eat pizza and drink wine! Coming to Grazie is like coming home. It is a small restaurant with a great patio. After just a few visits you are greeted by Maurizio, Sandy and the rest of the staff (and some of the customers) as a friend of the family.  The pizza, is thin crust and cooked in a brick oven. I have had each of the pizzas and while I have my favorites (Dame Edna and Vegetriana) they are all really good! This is artisan pizza at its best!  The salads are good sized.  The Emiliana and Caesar are very different from each other and delicious.  The wines are all Italian and reasonably priced.  I have learned to LOVE Chianti!  Who knew it was a really good wine and not just for that stuff in the raffia trimmed bottles!  For dessert try the Dolce Calzone!  Bananas, Nutella and ice cream--WOW!

k2jdiolpGmhBRZVtZEa6Ig.text: My family and I have gone to Grazie on many occasions and each time has been a fantastic experience.  Their food is to notch, by far the best pizza I have ever had.   The atmosphere is very relaxed and fun. Definitely a great choice to eat.  Highly recommended.

thU9LYvSoZ_Q9PaYfsR6Dg.text: WORST EXPERIENCE WITH A MANAGER/OWNER OF A RESTAURANT AND WORST PIZZA IVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!!!! I ordered a pizza from Grazie for pick up since its not far from where I live,and wanted to try something new. To my disappointment the pizza I ordered came out incorrect, folded over, and DRY AS A BOARD WHEN I ORDERED EXTRA SAUCE. So, I called the manager to let them know about the order, but was totally thrown off, as he had A COMPLETELY RUDE ATTITUDE, was highly combative, did NOT make any attempt to make it right and in fact said to me that if I were to go to the restaurant to show him the pizza that he would kick me out and call the police on me - and of course then hung up the phone on me. I've eaten out to eat for almost every meal since I was young, and I have NEVER been treated so poorly and for sure never threatened by a manager/owner (who was a male btw..) I don't like being negative, but what happened tonight was NOT OK.. I do NOT recommend this place to anyone. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, POOR MANAGEMENT, HORRIBLE PIZZA!!! Save your money and do yourself a favor by NEVER EAT AT GRAZIE!!!

LmSxE0EnmUJTHRCS-R-FYw.text: The worst. !!!! We came not late on a friday so you wouldn't think they would have excuses for everything we asked for. They didn't have majority of basic ingredients (cheese)  therefore a lot of what we ordered we couldn't get. Then no banana either because oh they "just used our last one ". But we will still bring you that dessert and add extra ice cream! Oh but since "the freezer was opened too many times throughout the night it's all melted."! So it was poured onto the dessert anyway. Looked awful. Terrible presentation. They didn't even offer to comp the desserts or any of our meal!!!  Not great customer service if your wanting customers to return eh? Then took about 45 minutes to figure out splitting the bill   Like they don't do that often. Then finally when our waitress dressed in overalls and converse (not really a wine bar attire) figured it out she commented "I did you a favor since it said no split checks for Parties over 6 people". Rude .  Would not to back or recommend to waste your time or money at this place   Wish I had zero stars to give. Then I called to complain to the owner. He was not available of course.  I got a call back finally A WEEK later from our server!!!! She wouldn't let me speak to a manager or owner.  Hahahahaha.  She was instead making up excuses for everything I mentioned above including everything is fresh from a specific place in Italy yadayadayada and we run out of things often. Well if you want customers have what they want especially that early on a Friday . Im sure come Sunday night they have nothing on the menu! She kept rambling on about how hard being a server is blah blah . Yeah well lady im a pediatric RN and it's hard but I don't complain that to my patients like you do your customers!!!! it was a waste of my time to hear her I ended up hanging up. Haha. Would go to McDonald's for dinner over this place any night !!!! Don't waste your time here again.

jQiPV8HawvCkVKELX0QLpQ.text: This is a great pizza place ... even better when it's nice enough to sit on their amazing patio!  My girlfriend and I shared a bottle of Sangria, which was tasty.  We've been here twice.  Service is definitely hit-and-miss.  One time we went there, the server was too busy.  The other time, the server forgot to return my credit card.  The pizzas are good.  Nothing spectacular, but definitely good.

pSUZFH7eyqIQcGMOoEtr1A.text: We first tried Grazie because it was within walking distance of the Hotel Valley Ho and we were in the mood for Italian.  Basically, if I see the words "Carpaccio" or "Bolognese" on a menu, I'm sold.  I never claimed to be a discriminating Yelper.    In this case, the Bolognese in question was the lasagna.  It was so good!  It comes piping hot served in a bowl, so it's more of a deconstructed lasagna.  And there is a little bit of grease that floats up from the meat and cheese that you can mop up with your bread.  Hey, I *walked* to the restaurant, right?  The Carpaccio is also good and I have not had the pizza, but it looked and smelled delicious.  We will be back in Scottsdale next month and I'm already dreaming about that creamy and delicious lasagna!

tkHB7zwv22fh_OdyUZjPkQ.text: I'm still so confused about this place. Two of us walked in there at 8:50 pm on a Saturday (we were dressed really nicely- not that it should matter or whatever). About 25-30% of the tables were empty. One man (a manager I believe) told us he would be right with us, so we waited about 5 min. Then a waitress came up to us and said "I'm sorry, I don't think we can seat you, we are really busy." It was so bizarre- there were so many tables open and the kitchen didn't close for over another hour. We went an ate elsewhere, but it was really weird and kind of offensive just being denied like that.

qPUPV3akkwm15qIqG0Igfw.text: Best eggplant I've had since my grandmother died  years ago.  NICE AND THIN!!  Excellent tomato sauce, delicious cheese, al dente pasta on the side.  Fresh earthy olive oil to accompany the bread, and a delicious cannoli and espresso to top it all off.   If youre looking for legitimate, fresh homestyle italian this is the place you need to go for dinner!

aE7sdFkBNtXyVIvYBKedGg.text: It's been long overdue and I should have left a review several years ago when I first dined here back in 2005. This place is by far, MY FAVORITE PIZZA RESTAURANT ! And its just not any pizza restaurant---their pizzas are made old school the authentic Italian way in a brick wood fire oven like it is done in Italy. We live in CA, but every time we come to visit my parents we make it a priority  to eat at Grazie. Our favorites are the Scamorza  (appetizer), Insalata  Della  Casa(salad), Sofia, Dame Edna, and the Dolce  Della  Casa (dessert). We just came back from visiting Italy and Grazie is the closest place that I could think of for authentic Italian pizza! LOVE THIS PLACE!

6-jso2Y7eXRbi04g4kbmiw.text: Dinner tonight...off the chart good...garlic bread...off menu... best in Scottsdale... osso buco was wonderful.. pasta was perfect. My new favorite place.

AOQuV8doSkSyUMgT-W0xCw.text: Grazie in Old Town Scottsdale is the hidden gem of pizza restaurants here in the Valley. Everyone knows about Pizzeria Bianco and Cibo...but for my money Grazie puts out pies that are just as good, if not better (dare I say).  I came here over the weekend and the pizza we decided on was the Complimenti Alla Mama: red sauce, mozzarella, ricotta, ham, salame, and parmigiano reggiano. I'm not over selling this when I say it may have been one of the top three best pizzas I've ever had in my life.  I also enjoy the wine list as its very Italian focused, the service is pretty good, and if you're coming for the first time you can't leave without having dessert. Don't worry about picking one out, you have to order the Dolce Della Casa: slightly charred sweet calzone filled with Nutella and bananas, topped with vanilla ice cream.  In summary: I'm getting hungry just writing this review and I can't wait to go back.

tWNa2MM7LQCutlWuCkYsfQ.text: Nice atmosphere. Very nice presentation of the meal. Friendly staff. Food was awful at best. Very bland cardboard. We did have a party of 14, but seated at 6pm saw 1st pizza at 6:30 and the last pizza came out at 7:55. Other groups came at and left before we were even finished being served. Felt bad that others in my party had to wait to be served below par food. The staff did apologize and comp 3 pizza and offered a dessert.  Oh I forgot, when they brought out the kabob. It was raw. They forgot to cook it. Oops! Not a good experience. Will not recommend or return. To be clear. Wait staff were very kind and gracious. The problem is the kitchen.

8D7VP56iaC_4vGNQsNdRhg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in South Scottsdale. It's a go-to date night choice for my fiance and I. Romantic atmosphere, AMAZING food and the owner is really nice and always stops by your table to check up on how things are going. One word of advice though- come hungry, and save room for dessert. The Nutella Banana dessert is out of this world! Get it with a scoop of ice cream and thank me later ;)

wRU94UPT2cDqHHBQ85LU-g.text: This place is aaaamazing! I've been a devoted guest for last 5 years and things are just getting better and better!  The menu was recently updated and, frankly, now they have the best sea food pasta in the whole town! I mean it! You should also try pasta boscaiola (spicy salsiccia, funghi di bosco and absolutely delicious creamy sauce!). And new chicken parmigiana is just to die for! Add a great choice of fine wine, and here we go: a perfect night out!

DjmcE11K1Kqi4hIwEBQpQw.text: How does a good restaurant becomes just another restaurant. i have been reading how others have commented that Grazie used to be good but not lately. This was exactly our experience in our last visit.  grazie was famous for its wood fired pizza with fresh dough and great flavors. We ordered Toscana which has saussage as a topping. i found the tomato sauce sweet, the saussage tastless and pulverized, and most importantly the dough to be different than the old bubbly Artisan dough. we probably could have done better with a frozen pizza.  i also noticed the same tomato sauce on the amatriciana pasta. our server was fantastic and running everywhere taking care of all the tables with the owners just chatting. at one point we needed something and although the owners acknowledged this, they waited to point to the server to come and attend to us.  we told our server about the tastless pizza  and she was very appreciative of the comment but once again we were expecting an owner or a manager also to come and acknowledge or respond to the criticism.  this is not the Grazie we were used to.

hkaJX6mxE9YlFYqtE5yZcA.text: Great brick oven pizza. Awesome atmosphere. Alexandra was very attentive to a very large party. You will love it!

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wonderful atmosphere!

LGaB3s6t8GuIyAeCu6czgQ.text: Terrible Napoli pizza. Terrible, slow service. Pizza was 1/2 burnt. 1/2 raw. We had a party of 15-20, 3 dishes sent back in total.  Lasagne tasted like chef boyardee, or worse.  Servers took 15 mins to bring a can of soda. Just awful from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of GRAZIE - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. All pepperoni in one pile, all cheese on one side. Crust was burnt on one side, raw on the other.  Bad!

qjoydBzY5zxDhe2wqNiGig.text: Stopped in here today and had the tuscana pizza. It was delicious. Crust was perfect. I like that it's independently owned and not a chain. Gluten free is a huge plus.

jaDm85YsI-zAQY6MDgb7dQ.text: Extremely disappointed with service; warmed bread finally brought to the table & olive oil provided about ten minutes later, after bread has cooled. Food brought 90 MINUTES after arriving for reservation.  One eggplant order dry, after apparently toasting under heat lamps. Salad dressing never provided.   Pizza very good.   Dolci "special"dessert is burned but served anyway!   Definitely the type of restaurant that you hurry to pay the bill just to end the agony...  Bathroom is filthy.  Believe the reviews on service & don't risk a special event here.

hfAzEN_bxDrbzAvaLsA0Fg.text: Yum! Cute, yummy restaurant. Best gluten free pizza crust I've ever had. Ambience is lovely. Very romantic. One of my new fave pizza places.

Zou3Wkwd4HlN1ZEBWAFR1g.text: Had the WORST experience here ever. I have been going to Grazie on and off for at least 7 years. After tonight's service I will never be going back. This place has REALLY gone downhill.   Pizza: just ok..too much competition out there for this pizza to be 4-5 stars like it used to.
